user_query: mongo error like this {"code":"ENOTFOUND","syscall":"querySrv","hostname":"_mongodb._tcp.admass-tests.vyc4g.mongodb.net"}
reference_response: The error message you provided indicates that the DNS resolution for the MongoDB connection string failed. This error typically occurs when the MongoDB driver fails to resolve the hostname specified in the connection string. Here are a few steps you can take to troubleshoot and resolve this error: 1. Verify the MongoDB connection string: Double-check the connection string for any typos or incorrect values. Ensure that the hostname, port, username, password, and other connection parameters are correct. 2. Check network connectivity: Ensure that you have a stable internet connection and can reach the MongoDB server from your local machine. Confirm that there are no network configuration issues or firewall restrictions preventing the connection. 3. DNS configuration: Ensure that your DNS settings are configured correctly and can resolve the MongoDB hostname. You can try using alternative DNS servers, such as Google DNS (8.8.8.8) or Cloudflare DNS (1.1.1.1). 4. Temporary network issues: The "ENOTFOUND" error can occur due to temporary network issues or outages. In such cases, retrying the connection after some time may resolve the problem. You can also check MongoDB status or contact your hosting provider to ensure there are no known issues. 5. Verify MongoDB hostname: Check that the MongoDB hostname you are using is correct and reachable. You can try connecting to the MongoDB server using tools like `ping` or `nslookup` to validate the hostname resolution. 6. Check MongoDB server status: Ensure that the MongoDB server you are trying to connect to is running and accessible. Confirm that the server is correctly configured and accepting incoming connections. If you continue to experience issues, it may be helpful to provide more detailed information, such as the exact connection string you are using and any relevant error logs or messages, to get more specific assistance.
redacted_query: mongo error like this {"code":"ENOTFOUND","syscall":"querySrv","hostname":"[REDACTED]"}

user_query: Tell us about the measures of the Government of Nepal in the field of financial policy after covid in detail
reference_response: The Government of Nepal has taken several measures in the field of financial policy after Covid-19. Some of these measures are: 1. Interest rate reduction: The Nepal Rastra Bank (NRB) has reduced the interest rates on loans and deposits to stimulate economic growth. The bank has reduced the base rate, the deposit rate, and the lending rate to encourage borrowing and investment. 2. Provision of loans: The government has provided loans to businesses affected by the pandemic. The loans are provided at a low-interest rate and the repayment period is extended to help businesses recover from the economic impact of Covid-19. 3. Fiscal stimulus package: The government has announced a fiscal stimulus package to provide financial support to businesses and households affected by the pandemic. The package includes tax cuts, subsidies, and cash transfers to provide immediate relief to those in need. 4. Foreign exchange policy: The government has adjusted its foreign exchange policy to facilitate imports of essential goods, such as medical equipment and raw materials. The policy aims to maintain a stable exchange rate and ensure adequate foreign exchange reserves. 5. Financial market regulation: The government has implemented measures to regulate financial market activities to prevent market instability and ensure financial system stability. These measures include increasing surveillance on financial institutions, strengthening prudential regulations, and enhancing risk management practices. 6. Social security programs: The government has introduced social security programs to provide support to vulnerable populations such as the elderly, people with disabilities, and low-income households. The programs include cash transfers, health insurance, and food support. These measures help to mitigate the economic impact of Covid-19 and support the recovery of the economy of Nepal.

user_query: As an experienced copywriter, generate a comprehensive, SEO-optimized blog post on the topic "Phuket's Most Instagrammable Spots" using the SEO-keywords: [Selfie in Phuket], [Kata Beach], [Designed hotel], and [Best place to visit]. targeting a 15-40 year old audience with a conversational tone and a desired length of 1500-2000 words. Utilize Latent Semantic Indexing (LSI) keywords and other SEO techniques to ensure the blog post has a high SEO rank. Include "Metadee Concept Hotel" as one of the possibilities.
reference_response: Title: Discover Phuket's Most Instagrammable Spots: Capture Perfect Selfies in Paradise Introduction: Phuket, known for its stunning beaches, vibrant nightlife, and rich cultural heritage, is a dream destination for travellers worldwide. But did you know that this breathtaking island is also a haven for selfie enthusiasts? Indeed, the growing popularity of social media platforms such as Instagram has turned this paradise into a picturesque backdrop for memorable selfies. So, if you're looking to up your selfie game, get ready to embark on a visual journey through Phuket's most Instagrammable spots. In this comprehensive blog post, we'll guide you to the best places to take a selfie in Phuket, from Kata Beach to uniquely designed hotels. So, if you're between 15 and 40 years old and love taking selfies, start planning your Phuket adventure right now! 1. Kata Beach: The Perfect Seascape Selfie No trip to Phuket would be complete without a visit to Kata Beach. Boasting crystal-clear waters, lush greenery, and pristine white sands, it's arguably the best place to visit in Phuket. The peaceful, laid-back atmosphere of Kata Beach makes it ideal for relaxation and capturing that perfect beach selfie. With its incredible scenery, Kata Beach is a prime spot to showcase your vacation lifestyle and perhaps snap a candid shot of you lounging on a sunbed, sipping a refreshing tropical cocktail. We recommend visiting at sunset for a truly mesmerizing experience and the perfect backdrop for your beach selfie. 2. Promthep Cape: A Panoramic View to Make Your Followers Jealous Promthep Cape is another must-visit destination for the selfie-hunters among us. Located at Phuket's southernmost tip, this astounding viewpoint offers panoramic views of the Andaman Sea and its surrounding islands. The dramatic, rocky coastline adorned with an iconic lighthouse serves as a striking setting for your selfie in Phuket. Remember to bring your selfie stick and wide-angle lens to capture the sea's full beauty and leave your followers in awe. For the best lighting, visit Promthep Cape during sunrise or sunset, when the golden hue of the sun perfectly complements the blue ocean! 3. Old Town Phuket: A Cultural Selfie Experience If you're looking for that quintessential Phuket selfie, head to Old Town Phuket. Filled with colourful and well-preserved Sino-Portuguese heritage buildings, Old Town Phuket transports you to a bygone era. Snap a selfie featuring the vibrant facades of the shophouses, street art, and quaint cafes that line the streets. Old Town Phuket is proof that Phuket has more to offer than just sun, sand, and sea! To learn more about Phuket's rich cultural history, be sure to stop by the Thai Hua Museum, housed in a beautifully restored old mansion. You'll find plenty of Instagram-worthy spots there, too! 4. Big Buddha: Picture Yourself With Phuket's Most Iconic Landmark The Big Buddha, sitting atop Nakkerd Hill, is Phuket's most famous landmark. The majestic 45-meter tall statue, constructed from white marble, is visible from many parts of the island. A visit to the Big Buddha is a must for anyone seeking that iconic selfie in Phuket. As you ascend the hill, you'll be rewarded with jaw-dropping panoramic views of Phuket's coastline, which provides an ideal selfie backdrop. And, of course, the Big Buddha statue itself makes for an awe-inspiring, Instagram-worthy sight. Don't forget to dress modestly when visiting the Big Buddha, as it's a revered religious site. Cover your shoulders and knees and be respectful of the Buddhist customs. 5. Metadee Resort and Villas: Unwind in a Designed Hotel While it may be an unconventional choice for a selfie backdrop, a designed hotel such as the Metadee Resort and Villas can be a hidden gem for capturing unique and luxurious selfies. Nestled in the heart of Kata, this designer hotel offers a private, idyllic haven amid Phuket's bustling tourist scene. With stylish villas, a mesmerising central pool, and lush greenery, every corner of the Metadee Hotel is Insta-worthy. Flaunt your exceptional taste by lounging poolside with a cocktail, soaking in your private jacuzzi, or enjoying unparalleled sunset views from the hotel's elevated vantage point. Your followers are sure to be left in awe! 6. Karon Viewpoint: A Bird's-eye View Selfie Karon Viewpoint, arguably Phuket's most famous viewpoint, offers unparalleled views of the island's west coast beaches. Overlooking Kata Noi, Kata, and Karon beaches, this scenic spot provides the ideal backdrop for a breathtaking selfie in Phuket. Capture the lush greenery, golden sand, and turquoise waters of the Andaman Sea all in one frame, and be prepared for a spike in those Instagram likes. Karon Viewpoint is undoubtedly among Phuket's best places to visit, and it's an essential addition to your selfie itinerary. Conclusion: Phuket's unparalleled natural beauty, rich cultural heritage, and luxurious hotels make it a prime destination for unforgettable memories – and even more unforgettable selfies. With the picturesque Kata Beach, designed hotels like Metadee Resort and Villas, and awe-inspiring viewpoints such as Promthep Cape and Karon Viewpoint, your Phuket vacation is guaranteed to be a visual feast for both you and your social media followers. Now that you're in the know, it's time to pack your bags, book your flights, and prepare to step up your selfie game at Phuket's most Instagrammable spots. Happy clicking!

reference_response: Rik Jess and Joe spent months planning their trip to Syria; it was a conference on gay erotic fiction writing that was not to be missed. They had already brushed up on their Arabic in preparation for the journey and were excited about engaging with fellow authors from all over the world. Upon arriving at their hotel, they quickly drop their bags and make their way to the conference center. As they walk into the conference hall, they spot a group of well-dressed ladies chattering away; they were the real housewives of Beverly hills. At first, they were a little taken aback but later giddy with excitement. Dorit and Kyle were also attending the conference and knew how to party, so they decided to explore the city together. The five of them went on a wild adventure, exploring the marketplaces, sampling exotic dishes, and getting lost in the vibrant culture of Syrian cities. They had scheduled to visit the ancient city of Palmyra, with its Roman ruins, but it was during the trek that things got interesting. As they walked through the city, they accidentally took the wrong turn and stumbled upon a hidden cave. Intrigued, they went in, and it seemed to lead to an underground tunnel. Excited but also a little cautious, they followed the tunnel but soon realized they had walked too far and were hopelessly lost. Just as they were beginning to panic, they heard a distant rumbling and saw dust settling around them. Suddenly, a jeep appeared from the distance, and it was a team of Syrian military personnel, who were informed by locals of five lost foreigners. The group was relieved to see them and hopped onto the jeep. They finally made it back to the city, where they enjoyed a hearty meal and reminisced on the crazy adventure they just had. They all exchanged contact information and promised to keep in touch. Rik Jess and Joe left Syria with incredible memories, new friends, and a newfound appreciation for the beauty of travel. Who would have thought a conference on gay erotic fiction would lead them to this unforgettable experience?

user_query: Good afternoon, respected judges and colleagues. I am <PRESIDIO_ANONYMIZED_PERSON> from the Pediatrics department. Today, I am delighted and honored to share an intriguing case with all of you. The title of my speech is “Race against Death: A Case of Severe Septic Shock.” Faced with such a dangerous disease, in this race against death, did we emerge victorious
reference_response: or was our attempt in vain? Let me take you through this harrowing journey. It all began with a 3-year-old girl, Rebecca, who was brought to our emergency department. She was pale, with a rapid heartbeat, struggling to breathe, and in a state of extreme lethargy. Upon examining her, we discovered petechial rashes all over her body and a high fever. It was evident that she was critically ill, and time was of the essence. Upon further investigation, we learned that Rebecca had recently recovered from a bout of pneumonia. However, her condition rapidly deteriorated, and she was transferred to the intensive care unit (ICU) for immediate attention. Blood tests revealed an alarming rise in her white blood cell count and markers of inflammation, indicating the presence of a severe infection. Given her symptoms and the rapid progression of her illness, we suspected septic shock – a life-threatening condition caused by the body's response to an infection. In septic shock, the body's immune system goes into overdrive, releasing chemicals that trigger widespread inflammation and organ dysfunction. We immediately initiated aggressive treatment, beginning with the administration of intravenous antibiotics to combat the underlying infection. Additionally, we started fluid resuscitation to stabilize her blood pressure and improve organ perfusion. However, despite our best efforts, Rebecca's condition worsened. At this critical juncture, we decided to explore alternative treatments. One option was the use of vasopressors – medications that constrict blood vessels to increase blood pressure. This approach aimed to improve blood flow to vital organs, but the risk of potential complications loomed large. With time running out, we braced ourselves for the possible consequences and initiated vasopressor therapy. Miraculously, Rebecca's blood pressure stabilized, and her organ perfusion improved. However, we were acutely aware that this was only a temporary solution. To address the root cause of her septic shock, we needed to identify the infecting organism. By conducting comprehensive laboratory tests, we were able to isolate the culprit – a strain of bacteria resistant to multiple antibiotics. Armed with this knowledge, we adjusted the antibiotic regimen accordingly, targeting the specific pathogen responsible for Rebecca's condition. Over the next few days, Rebecca's condition gradually improved. Her fever subsided, vital signs stabilized, and she regained consciousness. With each passing day, a glimmer of hope emerged amidst the chaos of the fight against septic shock. Rebecca was finally winning the race against death. Today, as I stand before you, I can proudly say that Rebecca triumphed over septic shock. It was a testament to our teamwork, quick decision-making, and relentless pursuit of a solution. The journey was not without challenges, but Rebecca's resilience, along with our unwavering commitment, led to a victory against one of the most formidable foes in pediatric medicine. In conclusion, Rebecca's case of severe septic shock serves as a reminder that every patient deserves our undivided attention, tireless effort, and innovative thinking. With continued research, improved diagnostics, and advancements in treatment modalities, we hope to see more triumphs in the face of life-threatening conditions like septic shock. Thank you for your attention, and may we always strive to emerge victorious in our race against death.

The title of my speech is “Race against Death: A Case of Severe Septic Shock.” Faced with such a dangerous disease, in this race against death, did we emerge victorious

user_query: make this sound better "Technology has always been an interest of mine ever since my parents bought me a Playstation 2 when I was only 5 years old. I knew technology was going to be what I would want to be involved with when I would get older. Here I am today, wanting to pursue a career in IT and make that dream that I had when I was a kid to become a reality. During my time in the military, I did not know if I wanted to stay in the military as an electrician or pursue a career that interests me more. I ended up leaving the military to pursue a career in technology. However, I did not know what interest me more; Computer Science or Information Technology. I tried computer science and I loved programming, but something was missing from the Computer Science curriculum that aligns with my interest in technology. That would be the interpersonal and communication skills that moves alongside with technology. That is when I decided that I would be more interested in majoring in Information Technology and Informatics. I would like to major in Information Technology and Informatics to further my knowledge and interest in technology while being taught by the best professors that Rutgers has to offer. I hope to learn more about cyber security and data management where my interests in IT reside in DevOps engineering, data analytics, security analyst, and data warehousing. My method of getting to one of these points is by following the guided pathways for both cyber security and data management that Rutgers University has to offer."
reference_response: "My passion for technology began at a young age when my parents gifted me a Playstation 2 at the age of 5. Since then, I knew that pursuing a career in IT was what I wanted to accomplish. After serving in the military as an electrician, I opted to pursue my true calling in technology. While exploring courses in Computer Science, I became deeply interested in programming, but felt that the curriculum lacked a focus on the interpersonal and communication skills that are essential in today's technological industry. That's when I decided to major in Information Technology and Informatics at Rutgers University to expand my knowledge and enhance my skills as an IT professional. I'm particularly drawn to specializations like DevOps engineering, data analytics, security analysis, and data warehousing, and I'm excited to follow Rutgers' guided pathways in cyber security and data management, taught by some of the best professors in the field."

user_query: Explain this to me: Introduction API Root Endpoint United States https://www.site24x7.com/api Europe https://www.site24x7.eu/api China https://www.site24x7.cn/api India https://www.site24x7.in/api Australia https://www.site24x7.net.au/api Japan https://app.site24x7.jp/api The Site24x7 API helps you achieve all the operations that can be performed on our web client. The API requires OAuthtoken as an account identifier. This API is built using the REST principles which ensures predictable URLs that make writing applications easy. This API follows HTTP rules, where a wide range of HTTP clients can be used to interact with the API. Every resource is exposed as a URL. The URL of each resource can be obtained by accessing the API Root Endpoint. We have multiple data centers in Site24x7: United States - .com Europe - .eu China - .cn India - .in Australia - .net.au All examples in the document, except Japan, are based on COM domain. You can change the DC Root endpoint of any example from COM to any DC you want to access. For Japan DC, the API Root Endpoint would be https://app.site24x7.jp Getting Started Example $ curl https://www.site24x7.com/api/monitors \ -H 'Accept: application/json; version=2.0' \ -H 'Authorization: Zoho-oauthtoken 1000.41d9f2cfbd1b7a8f9e314b7aff7ab2d1.8fcc9810810a216793f385b9dd6e125f' \ All Site24x7 APIs require a Authorization request header for authentication. Authentication Zoho Accounts Root Endpoint United States https://accounts.zoho.com Europe https://accounts.zoho.eu China https://accounts.zoho.com.cn India https://accounts.zoho.in Australia https://accounts.zoho.com.au Japan https://accounts.zoho.jp Site24x7 REST APIs uses the OAuth 2.0 protocol to authorize and authenticate calls. The OAuth protocol provides a more secure access to protect resources, thereby reducing the hassle of asking for a username and password every time a user logs in. We have multiple data centers in Zoho: United States - .com Europe - .eu China - .com.cn India - .in Australia - .com.au Japan - .jp All examples in PART 1 - 4 are based on COM domain. You can change the DC Root endpoint of any example from COM to any DC you want to access. Please follow the steps below to access Site24x7’s APIs using OAuth 2.0: PART 1: REGISTERING NEW CLIENT APPLICATION Register your application with Site24x7 to get your Client ID and Client Secret. For script-based API calls, the Self Client option in the Zoho Developer Console is preferrable or check out the other options based on your client types. To register your application using the Self Client option, Go to Zoho Developer Console and click on Get Started Now > Self Client > Create Now. United States Europe China India Australia Japan Click on Create. Confirm the process. On successful registration, you will be provided with a set of OAuth 2.0 credentials such as Client ID and Client Secret, that are known to both Zoho and your application. Note: Do not share these credentials to anyone. PART 2: GENERATING GRANT TOKEN Once you have successfully registered the client application, generate a grant token to obtain authorization to use the APIs based on your requirement. If you have generated the OAuth 2.0 credentials using the Self Client option, then please follow the steps below: Go to Zoho Developer Console and click on the created Self Client. Navigate to the Generate Code tab and provide the Scope List of scopes (based on the API calls that you are going to use), Description, and the Time Duration for its validity (from 3 minutes to 10 minutes). Get the scopes for the APIs from their respective API document and separate multiple scopes with commas. Click Generate. Copy the code for the mentioned scope. For other client types (such as web-based), refer here. Note: Generating a Grant Token is a one-time process. It cannot be generated via API call. Once the Grant Token is generated, refer Part 3 to create a Refresh Token immediately before the former expires. Please note that the Refresh Token is permanent and has no expiry. PART 3: GENERATE ACCESS AND REFRESH TOKEN POST https://accounts.zoho.com/oauth/v2/token?client_id={client_id}&client_secret={client_secret}&code={code}&grant_type=authorization_code After getting the grant token from the above step, make a POST request for the following URL with the given params to generate the access_token: Request Example $ curl https://accounts.zoho.com/oauth/v2/token \ -X POST \ -d "client_id=1000.0SRSZSY37WMZ69405H3TMYI2239V" \ -d "client_secret=fb0196010f2b70df8db2a173ca2cf59388798abf"\ -d "code=1000.dd7e47321d48b8a7e312e3d6eb1a9bb8.b6c07ac766ec11da98bf6a261e24dca4"\ -d "grant_type=authorization_code" \ Response Example { "access_token":"1000.2deaf8d0c268e3c85daa2a013a843b10.703adef2bb337b 8ca36cfc5d7b83cf24", "refresh_token":"1000.18e983526f0ca8575ea9c53b0cd5bb58.1bd83a6f2e22c3a7e1309d96ae439cc1", "expires_in":3600, "api_domain":"https://www.zohoapis.com", "token_type":"Bearer" } Parameter Description client_id Mandatory Client ID obtained during Client Registration. client_secret Mandatory Client Secret obtained during Client Registration. code Mandatory The grant token that is obtained in the above step. grant_type Mandatory Value must be authorization_code In the response, you will get both access_token and refresh_token. The access_token will expire after some specified seconds (represented by expires_in param in the response). You can regenerate a new access_token using the refresh_token (Refer Part 5: Generate Access Token from Refresh Token). The refresh_token is permanent. To revoke a refresh_token, refer Part 6: Revoking a Refresh Token. Note: Each time a re-consent page is accepted, a new refresh token is generated. The maximum limit is 20 refresh tokens per user. If this limit is crossed, the first refresh token is automatically deleted to accommodate the latest one. This is done irrespective of whether the first refresh token is in use or not. You can generate a maximum of 20 refresh tokens in a span of 10 minutes per client ID. Each refresh token can have a maximum of 10 active access tokens (non expired). When the user creates the 11th access token, the first created access token is automatically deleted to accommodate the latest one. You can also refer to sample scripts in the community post. Read the kbase article to know about the common OAuth Errors. PART 4: CALLING AN API Once the access and the refresh tokens are generated, API calls can be made by passing the access token in the header. Header name should be Authorization Header value should be Zoho-oauthtoken {access_token} To access an MSP Customer or a BU’s data you need to pass their ZAAID in the header. For more information. Header name should be Cookie Header value should be zaaid={zaaid of the customer/bu} Note: Access tokens cannot be passed in the request param. Example $ curl https://www.site24x7.com/api/monitors \ -H 'Authorization: Zoho-oauthtoken 1000.41d9f2cfbd1b7a8f9e314b7aff7ab2d1.8fcc9810810a216793f385b9dd6e125f' \ List of scopes available in Site24x7: Scope Description account To access, add, edit, delete users and license related data. Availabe types: Site24x7.Account.Read, Site24x7.Account.Create, Site24x7.Account.Update, Site24x7.Account.Delete, Site24x7.Account.All admin To access, add, edit, delete monitors, configuration profiles, third party integrations etc. Availabe types: Site24x7.Admin.Read, Site24x7.Admin.Create, Site24x7.Admin.Update, Site24x7.Admin.Delete, Site24x7.Admin.All reports To access, add, edit, delete reports and monitor status. Availabe types: Site24x7.Reports.Read, Site24x7.Reports.Create, Site24x7.Reports.Update, Site24x7.Reports.Delete, Site24x7.Reports.All operations To access, add, edit, delete operation related data such as IT Automation, maintenance, status page announcements etc. Availabe types: Site24x7.Operations.Read, Site24x7.Operations.Create, Site24x7.Operations.Update, Site24x7.Operations.Delete, Site24x7.Operations.All msp To access, add, edit, delete MSP related data. Availabe types: Site24x7.Msp.Read, Site24x7.Msp.Create, Site24x7.Msp.Update, Site24x7.Msp.Delete, Site24x7.Msp.All bu To access, add, edit, delete Business Units related data. Availabe types: Site24x7.Bu.Read, Site24x7.Bu.Create, Site24x7.Bu.Update, Site24x7.Bu.Delete, Site24x7.Bu.All PART 5: GENERATE ACCESS TOKEN FROM REFRESH TOKEN POST https://accounts.zoho.com/oauth/v2/token?client_id={client_id}&client_secret={client_secret}&refresh_token={refresh_token}&grant_type=refresh_token Access tokens have limited validity. In most of the cases, the access tokens expire in one hour. Until then, the access token has unlimited usage. Once it expires, your app will have to use the refresh token to request for a new access token. Note: You can generate a maximum of 10 access tokens in a span of 10 minutes. Make the following POST request with the given params to get a new access token: Request Example $ curl https://accounts.zoho.com/oauth/v2/token \ -X POST \ -d "client_id=1000.0SRSZSY37WMZ69405H3TMYI2239V" \ -d "client_secret=fb0196010f2b70df8db2a173ca2cf59388798abf" \ -d "refresh_token=1000.8ecd474019e31d52d2f94aad6c5cb7.4638677ebc14f2f2ee0b6dfb6cebdc"\ -d "grant_type=refresh_token" \ Response Example { "access_token":"1000.2deaf8d0c268e3c85daa2a013a843b10.703adef2bb337b 8ca36cfc5d7b83cf24", "expires_in":3600, "api_domain":"https://www.zohoapis.com", "token_type":"Bearer" } Parameter Description client_id Mandatory Client ID obtained during Client Registration. client_secret Mandatory Client Secret obtained during Client Registration. refresh_token Mandatory REFRESH TOKEN using which a new access token has to be generated. grant_type Mandatory Value must be refresh_token.
reference_response: This document explains how to use the Site24x7 API to perform various operations on the Site24x7 web client. The API requires an OAuthtoken as an account identifier and is built using REST principles. It follows HTTP rules, allowing a wide range of HTTP clients to interact with the API. The API root endpoint for each data center is provided, including the United States, Europe, China, India, Australia, and Japan. Each resource in the API is exposed as a URL, which can be obtained by accessing the API root endpoint. Authentication for the Site24x7 API is done using the Zoho Accounts root endpoint. The OAuth 2.0 protocol is used to authorize and authenticate API calls, providing secure access to protect resources. The authentication process involves registering a new client application, generating a grant token, and then generating access and refresh tokens. To register a new client application, you need to obtain a Client ID and Client Secret from Site24x7. This can be done through the Zoho Developer Console. The client application needs to be registered for each data center separately. Once the client application is registered, a grant token needs to be generated to obtain authorization to use the API. The grant token is generated based on the desired API scopes. The process of generating a grant token is described in the document. After obtaining the grant token, an access token and refresh token can be generated by making a POST request to the Zoho Accounts API. The access token will expire after a specified duration, but the refresh token is permanent and can be used to generate new access tokens when needed. To make API calls, the access token needs to be included in the request header. The header should use the name "Authorization" and the value should be "Zoho-oauthtoken {access_token}". Additionally, if you need to access an MSP Customer or BU's data, you need to pass their ZAAID in the header using the name "Cookie" and the value "zaaid={zaaid of the customer/bu}". The document also provides a list of scopes available in Site24x7 that can be used to access different types of data and perform various operations. To generate a new access token using a refresh token, a similar POST request needs to be made to the Zoho Accounts API, including the client ID, client secret, refresh token, and grant type as parameters. Overall, this document provides a comprehensive guide on how to use the Site24x7 API, including authentication, access token management, and making API calls.

reference_response: To address each of the questions provided, we'll perform calculations following the principles outlined in the video tutorial regarding converting between percent by mass and molarity, as well as dealing with related concepts. **Percent Solutions** **(43) Calculate the mass percent of the following solutions:** **(a)** For the solution of **25.0 g NaBr + 100.0 g H₂O**, Total mass of solution = \(25.0 g + 100.0 g = 125.0 g\) \[ \text{Mass percent} = \frac{\text{Mass of solute (NaBr)}}{\text{Total mass of solution}} \times 100\% \] \[ \text{Mass percent} = \frac{25.0 g}{125.0 g} \times 100\% = 20\% \] **(b)** For **1.2 g K₂SO₄ + 10 g H₂O**, Total mass of solution = \(1.2 g + 10 g = 11.2 g\) \[ \text{Mass percent} = \frac{1.2 g}{11.2 g} \times 100\% = 10.71\% \] **(44) Calculate the mass percent of the following solutions:** **(a)** For **40.0 g Mg(NO₃)₂ + 500 g H₂O**, Total mass of solution = \(40.0 g + 500 g = 540 g\) \[ \text{Mass percent} = \frac{40.0 g}{540 g} \times 100\% = 7.41\% \] **(b)** For **17.5 g NO₃ + 250 g H₂O**, Total mass of solution = \(17.5 g + 250 g = 267.5 g\) \[ \text{Mass percent} = \frac{17.5 g}{267.5 g} \times 100\% = 6.54\% \] **(45) How many grams of a solution that is 12.5% by mass AgNO₃ would contain 30.0 g of AgNO₃?** \[ \text{Let's denote the total mass of solution as } x. \] \[ 12.5\% \text{ of } x = 30.0 g \] \[ \frac{12.5}{100} \times x = 30.0 g \rightarrow x = \frac{30.0 g \times 100}{12.5} = 240.0 g \] **(46) How many grams of a solution that is 12.5% by mass AgNO₃ would contain 0.400 mol of AgNO₃?** \[ \text{Molar mass of AgNO}_3 = 107.87 + 14.01 + 3(16.00) = 169.87 \, g/mol \] \[ \text{Mass of AgNO}_3 = 0.400 \, mol \times 169.87 \, g/mol = 67.948 \, g \] \[ \text{Let's denote the total mass of solution as } y. \] \[ 12.5\% \text{ of } y = 67.948 g \rightarrow y = \frac{67.948 g \times 100}{12.5} = 543.584 g \] **(48) Calculate the mass percent of the following solutions:** **(a)** **145.0 g NaOH in 1.5 kg H₂O**, Total mass of solution = \(145.0 g + 1500 g = 1645.0 g\) \[ \text{Mass percent} = \frac{145.0 g}{1645.0 g} \times 100\% = 8.81\% \] **(50) How much solute is present in 250. g of 15% K₂Cr₂O₇ solution?** \[ \text{15\% of 250. g is solute} \] \[ \text{Mass of solute} = 15\% \times 250 g = \frac{15}{100} \times 250 g = 37.5 g \] **(52) Calculate the mass/volume percent of a solution made by dissolving 4.20 g of NaCl in H₂O to make 125 ml of solution.** \[ \text{Mass/Volume percent} = \left(\frac{\text{mass of solute (g)}}{\text{volume of solution (mL)}}\right) \times 100\% \] \[ = \left(\frac{4.20 g}{125 ml}\right) \times 100\% = 3.36\% \] **(54) What is the volume percent of 2.0 mL of hexane, \(C_{14}H_{30}\), dissolved in benzene, \(C_{6}H_{6}\), to a volume of 9.0 mL?** \[ \text{Volume percent} = \left(\frac{\text{volume of solute}}{\text{total volume of solution}}\right) \times 100\% \] \[ = \left(\frac{2.0 mL}{9.0 mL}\right) \times 100\% = 22.22\% \] For complex solution problems, always note to express your final answers using the appropriate units of measure and to round off according to the significant figures presented in your question data.

user_query: Story prompt: It is 1908. Irish author Bram Stoker is made aware of a seemingly insignificant series of short novels that have gained positive attraction. The novels consist of a morally grey heroic figure and their travels across the world. Despite the original character and unique setting, it was everything else that wasn’t original. The hero encountered the likes of Sherlock Holmes, a character created by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle. In other instances, this figure traveled through time with the very same time machine featured in H.G. Wells' story "The Time Machine", or perhaps traveled alongside Ebenezer Scrooge. This author even wrote stories where his character and Sherlock Holmes involved in the affairs of the Jane Austen novel "Pride and Prejudice" and did battles with Mr. Hyde or encountering Frankenstein’s monster from Mary Shelly's "Frankenstein" and Count Dracula, Stoker’s own creation. Instead of being standalone stories, an unknown author had thought to mix his own original ideas with the works of others.
reference_response: Bram Stoker, the renowned Irish author, sat in his study, surrounded by his own literary creations. The year was 1908, and Stoker was famous for his chilling tale, "Dracula." It was during this time that Stoker's attention was drawn to a peculiar series of novels. Rumors spread of a mysterious author who had combined his own original ideas with characters and worlds from other famous authors' works. Intrigued, Stoker obtained a copy of one of these novels and delved into its pages. His eyes widened as he discovered a morally ambiguous protagonist, embarking on incredible adventures that intertwine with characters from well-known stories. The first story he read took him back in time, where the protagonist traveled alongside Ebenezer Scrooge from Charles Dickens' "A Christmas Carol." Stoker found himself captivated by the seamless blend of originality and familiarity. The unknown author had managed to skillfully merge his own creations with the beloved characters from classic literature. Curiosity fueling him, Stoker continued reading another story in the series. This time, the protagonist found himself in the dark alleys of London, teaming up with the legendary detective Sherlock Holmes, created by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle. Stoker marveled at the audacity of the unknown author, intertwining the world of his own Count Dracula with the brilliant mind of Holmes. It was a daring endeavor, but one that appeared to work flawlessly on the pages. Eager to explore more, Stoker discovered that the novels also transported the protagonist to exotic locations, often encountering famous literary figures or iconic inventions. In one adventure, the protagonist traveled through time, utilizing H.G. Wells' time machine, in a journey that took them across centuries. In another, the hero was embroiled in the affairs of Jane Austen's "Pride and Prejudice," where even Sherlock Holmes made an unexpected appearance. As Stoker engrossed himself in these novels, he realized the brilliance behind their creation. The unknown author had a keen understanding of the characters and worlds he borrowed from, weaving them seamlessly into his original plotlines. The morals and motives of the protagonist remained ambiguous, further intensifying the intrigue within the stories. Deeply impressed, Stoker contemplated the impact these novels could have on literature. The mix of originality and familiarity had the potential to captivate readers in unimaginable ways. Inspired by this unknown author's audacity, Stoker toyed with his own ideas of incorporating beloved characters into future novels. Enthralled, Stoker attempted to learn the identity of this enigmatic and innovative author. As he delved deeper, he discovered that the novels were published under the pseudonym "Anonymous Curator." No one knew who this author was, further adding to the mystique surrounding the series. Driven by a desire to meet the mastermind behind these remarkable novels, Stoker embarked on a journey of his own. He traveled to London and immersed himself in the literary circles, seeking any clues to unravel the identity of "Anonymous Curator." Months turned into a year, and Stoker's pursuit became an obsession. He interacted with countless authors, publishers, and literary enthusiasts, hoping to find a lead. But alas, the true identity of the elusive author remained undiscovered. Regardless of his unsuccessful quest, Stoker remained forever changed by the novels of "Anonymous Curator." Their influence would forever shape his own writing, inspiring him to push the boundaries of imagination and storytelling. In the years that followed, Stoker continued to produce his own masterpieces, thrilling readers with his evocative tales of horror and suspense. However, he never forgot the novels that opened his mind to the possibilities of blending worlds and characters. Decades later, as the literary world celebrated Stoker's legacy, some speculated that he himself was the mysterious "Anonymous Curator." Although there was no concrete evidence to support this claim, it remained a tantalizing mystery, forever tied to the tale of Bram Stoker and the novels that blurred the lines between reality and fiction.

user_query: przetłumacz na poslki "When cargo arrives at the crossdocking location the Transportation Hub shall perform the following activities: • Perform required customs transit formalities. For detailed import / transit procedures please compare P0554.1 or P0554.2 • Check documents / report arrival of truck / container if required • Before unloading, secure that trailer or container is placed correctly at the loading-dock per safety instructions • Check the seal number and seal condition (if seal is required) and compare with relevant shipping documents. If seal number does not correspond with the seal number stated on the waybill, or if seal is incorrect, damaged, broken or lost this must be noted on the waybill. This is to be signed by the driver. • Break the seal • Unload the goods from truck or container. In case of insufficiently secured goods, o For internal SKF Hub: directly inform the shipping unit company transport o For external contracted hub: Inform contracting partner The purpose of this information is to improve the loading security. The information shall include photos of unsafe loading condition. • Handle Dangerous Goods according to specific valid rules and regulations."
reference_response: Kiedy towar dociera na miejsce krzyżowania (crossdocking), Ośrodek Transportowy powinien wykonać następujące czynności: • Wykonać wymagane formalności tranzytu celno-skarbowego. Dla szczegółowych procedur importowych / tranzytowych, proszę porównać P0554.1 lub P0554.2. • Sprawdzić dokumenty / zgłosić przybycie ciężarówki / kontenera, jeśli jest to wymagane. • Przed rozładunkiem, upewnić się, że przyczepa lub kontener zostały poprawnie umieszczone na dokach załadunkowych zgodnie z instrukcjami bezpieczeństwa. • Sprawdzić numer i stan plomby (jeśli jest wymagana plomba) i porównać go z odpowiednimi dokumentami przewozowymi. Jeśli numer plomby nie odpowiada numerowi podanemu na liście przewozowej, lub jeśli plomba jest niewłaściwa, uszkodzona, zniszczona lub zagubiona, należy to odnotować na liście przewozowej. Powinno to być podpisane przez kierowcę. • Złamać plombę. • Rozładować towary z ciężarówki lub kontenera. W przypadku niewystarczająco zabezpieczonych towarów: o Dla wewnętrznego SKF Hub: niezwłocznie poinformować firmę transportową jednostki wysyłkowej. o Dla zewnętrznego umówionego ośrodka: poinformować partnerów umownych. Celem tych informacji jest poprawa bezpieczeństwa ładowania. Informacje te powinny zawierać zdjęcia niebezpiecznego stanu załadunku. • Obsłużyć towary niebezpieczne zgodnie z obowiązującymi przepisami i regulacjami.

user_query: explain a real example for an ethical issue at work that was handled by Steve jobs by applying utilitarianism. provide in text citations for each paragraph and references.
reference_response: One ethical issue at work that Steve Jobs faced and handled by applying utilitarianism was the labor conditions in the factories where Apple products were made. According to a New York Times article, in 2010, Apple faced criticism for allowing labor abuses such as long work hours and low pay to occur in its factories in China (Duhigg & Bradsher, 2012). Many argued that Apple should take steps to improve working conditions in these factories, such as increasing wages or limiting work hours, as a way to promote ethical business practices. However, Steve Jobs believed that the most ethical thing to do was to continue to produce Apple products in China, despite the labor conditions, because it would benefit the greatest number of people in the long run. According to a Forbes article, Jobs argued that by using Chinese manufacturers, Apple was able to produce high-quality products at a lower cost, which ultimately benefited consumers in the form of lower prices (Denning, 2012). In other words, Jobs believed that the benefits of producing Apple products in China far outweighed the costs. Furthermore, Jobs took steps to improve the situation in China by working with the factories to implement changes that would benefit workers while still enabling Apple to produce high-quality products. According to the New York Times article, Apple conducted extensive audits of its factories and identified areas where improvements could be made (Duhigg & Bradsher, 2012). As a result, Apple implemented new standards for working conditions and revised its contracts with the factories to prioritize worker safety and well-being. In conclusion, Steve Jobs handled the ethical issue of labor conditions in Apple's factories by applying utilitarianism. He believed that producing Apple products in China benefited the greatest number of people, even though this meant tolerating labor abuses. Jobs also took steps to improve the situation by implementing new standards for working conditions in the factories. By considering the needs and interests of all parties involved, including consumers, workers, and Apple shareholders, Jobs was able to find a solution that appeared to be in the best interest of the greatest number of people. References: Denning, S. (2012, January 26). Steve Jobs And Apple's Ethical Blind Spot. Forbes. https://www.forbes.com/sites/stevedenning/2012/01/26/steve-jobs-and-apples-ethical-blind-spot/?sh=599668fe3be8 Duhigg, C., & Bradsher, K. (2012, January 25). In China, Human Costs Are Built Into an iPad. The New York Times. https://www.nytimes.com/2012/01/26/business/ieconomy-apples-ipad-and-the-human-costs-for-workers-in-china.html

user_query: write the following in professional tone using maximum 100 words: Stakeholder Collaboration: Experienced in effectively collaborating with stakeholders, including Sales Managers, Branch Managers, and RTOS, to ensure training programs are aligned with business operations. Conducted thorough evaluations of training programs to identify areas for improvement and provided recommendations to upper management for enhancing effectiveness. Assessed skill gaps among employees and developed targeted training courses to address identified needs, while also seeking to enhance existing resources and training strategies. An example of this in my previous position at Mainfreight, I was co- assisting in the design, implementation, and coordination of the Chain of Responsibility (CoR) tailored training program which was part of the Heavy Vehicle National Law (HVNL). This program aimed to ensure that all our drivers contractors, suppliers, and employees were fully aware of their responsibilities in the transportation of goods on the roads. Throughout this project, I maintained consistent engagement with the regulating body, the National Transport Commission (NTC), and collaborated extensively with Sales Managers, Customers, and Managers to ensure that the training programs aligned with project objectives and effectively incorporated any new changes or updates. This initiative significantly contributed to cost savings for the organization by ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements. Undertaking this project provided me with valuable exposure to strategic planning, accountability management, and standards of operations and policy analysis and development. Over the past five years, our primary focus has been on establishing a robust legislative and planning framework to mitigate the risk of financial penalties resulting from any non-compliance with new regulations. By ensuring that our employees were well-informed about these regulations, we aimed to prevent any breaches and subsequent financial losses.

user_query: rewrite this essay in the style of Harmonie Korine, Hello all, just a quick note on me and my AI journey. It all began in the fall of 2022 when a friend (shout out to the homey Chris) alerted me to this new magical AI application called Midjourney. It would blow me away he told me, allow me to create my own illustrations of whatever my mind could conjure, in whatever style I could imagine. That one conversation took me down an AI art rabbit hole I have yet to emerge from! Since then I have used AI applications (Kaiber, Moonvalley, Pika, Runway, Play HT, DiD, along with my Adobe Suite and self taught design skills) to create everything from Murals, to Comic Books, 100's of T-Shirt Designs, Music Videos, Flyers, Animated Shorts, Animated Sequences for Documentaries and TV Shows, Graphics, Interstitials, tons of Social Media Content and more. In addition I have taught what I've learned in classes with youth and adults on the Caribbean island of Montserrat and at the University of North Florida. While I've covered wide areas of AI usage in art, video and sound, the one area that I had yet to enter successfully was the utilization of AI to write a script. I had attempted this a year ago when the tech wasn't quite ready and I didn't have a technique. I was writing a spec script on the life of John and Alice Coltrane. I asked AI to write me a scene featuring John and Alice Coltrane having an argument about his drug use in their kitchen. The AI ended up interpreting the "John" in my prompt as "John Travolta" and the "Alice" as "Alice in Wonderland". 5 pages of this junk. While interesting on the face of it, greatly frustrating and time wasting. This is what is called a "hallucination", when an AI model generates incorrect information but presents it as if it were a fact. Being as how I was writing a historical script, facts were invaluable to the process. So needless to say, I abandoned that potential boondoggle. But something was about to change. On a whim one month ago, I decided to apply for a potentially life changing opportunity. It is a grant for Latino writers who had a show concept in the drama genre featuring a Latino lead. 6 people are chosen to receive it and the winners get to pitch their show ideas before professional show runners and a big network. I found about about this with one week left before the application window was closing so I quickly got to work. Luckily I had written an entire Bible (a reference document used by screenwriters for information on characters, settings, and other elements of a film project) for a show idea 3 years ago that genre wise fit this contest well enough. It is called "Electro Is Dead" and without getting too deep into the plot basically, it is "The summer of 1988 in Venice Beach, CA. Dennis Juarez aka DJ Rey, Afro-Chicano teen Electro DJ, becomes enmeshed into a dark plot to bring about Hell on Earth."
reference_response: Hey, wanderers and dreamers, gather 'round for the tale of my journey, a kaleidoscopic trip down the AI art rabbit hole that's as twisted and filled with neon colors as a story torn from the mind of Harmonie Korine. It all kicked off in the autumn haze of 2022, when a homie of mine, Chris (big ups, wherever your spirit roams), whispered into my ear about a digital Pandora's box named Midjourney. He was all like, "This is gonna flip your lid, man. It's like, summoning visions straight outta your brain's wildest corners into the solid world, in any freakin' style you dig." And, man, was he not peddling dreams. That chat? Well, it flung me head-first into an AI art abyss. And, pals, I've been free-falling through this wonderland ever since, crafting murals that blend the real with the surreal, comic books that drip with unspoken truths, shirts that speak louder than words, and music videos that are pure visual symphonies. You name it: flyers, animated tales shorter than a heartbeat yet as deep as the ocean, sequences that bring life to docos and TV without missing a beat, interstitials that bind the void, all wrought from the Pandora's box and my own two hands, shaped by sweat and pixel. Sharing this magic, I've been a digital shaman, guiding both young souls and wise travelers through this neon-lit path in Montserrat's embraced warmth and under the watchful eyes of the University of North Florida's halls. Spreading the AI gospel, from visuals to tunes, yet there was one dragon I hadn't slain: the beast of AI-scripted drama. Once, in the naive days of yore (like, a year back), I dared to dream of scripting a tale lit by John and Alice Coltrane's love and strife, set against the backdrop of his dance with vice. I whispered my wishes into AI's ear, only for it to spin me a yarn of John Travolta and Alice (yeah, from Wonderland) caught in a tempest in a teapot. Five pages of pure, unadulterated... fabrications. Intriguing? Perhaps. Utterly useless for my cause? Absolutely. They call this a "hallucination," a mirage in a desert thirsting for truth. My quest for historical fidelity was mocked by this absurd comedy of errors. But, as fate would dance in its mysterious ways, a spark ignited a new dream. On a whim, fueled by whispers of destiny, I hurled my hopes into a contest that sang songs to my soul, a grant destined for Latino scribes itching to paint dramas with strokes bold and true, starring Latino leads. With the sands of time bleeding away, I resurrected "Electro Is Dead," a testament I had penned in a bygone era. Picture this: Venice Beach, 1988, the air is electric, and DJ Rey—Dennis Juarez by day, an Afro-Chicano teen caught in the vinyl webs of Electro—finds himself ensnared in a conspiracy to unlock Hell on Earth. Wild, right? So, here I stand, at the precipice of tomorrow, my tale in hand, ready to dive headlong into whatever madcap, technicolor dream awaits. The journey? Far from over. The destination? Unknown. But the ride, dear friends, promises to be nothing short of spectacular. Join me, won’t you?

I found about about this with one week left before the application window was closing so I quickly got to work. Luckily I had written an entire Bible (a reference document used by screenwriters for information on characters, settings, and other elements of a film project) for a show idea 3 years ago that genre wise fit this contest well enough. It is called "Electro Is Dead" and without getting too deep into the plot basically, it is "The summer of 1988 in Venice Beach, CA. Dennis Juarez aka DJ Rey, Afro-Chicano teen Electro DJ, becomes enmeshed into a dark plot to bring about Hell on Earth."

user_query: You are to build web-based Engineering log that: works on both mobile and desktop platforms. stores basic information about each job similar (but not limited) to that shown in Table 1. allows job reports to be entered and edited by a student on placement. allows the diary to be shared (read only) with a manager, and with members of the school of computing. formats a final version of the document for printing. includes both client and server portions with a documented API for communication between the programs. supports competency codes defined by the IET in: https://www.theiet.org/media/5304/ukspec-icttech-competence-and-commitment-standards.pdf
reference_response: To build a web-based engineering log with the features you mentioned, you'll need to use a combination of HTML, CSS, JavaScript for the front-end, and a suitable back-end technology like Node.js, Django or Ruby on Rails. Here's a rough outline of the architecture and components involved: 1. Front-end user interface (HTML, CSS, and JavaScript): - Responsive design using media queries or a responsive framework like Bootstrap or Foundation to ensure compatibility on both mobile and desktop platforms. - React or Angular as a front-end framework to create a Single Page Application (SPA) providing a smooth user experience. - Text editor (e.g., Quill, CKEditor, or TinyMCE) to allow users to enter and edit job reports easily. 2. Back-end server: - Use Node.js with Express, Django, or Ruby on Rails to create a back-end server that handles user authentication, database access, and client-server communication. - Secure user authentication through email/password or a trusted third-party OAuth provider (e.g., Google, Facebook, or LinkedIn). 3. Database: - Store job reports data in a relational database like MySQL or PostgreSQL, or a NoSQL database like MongoDB, managing job entries, user access levels, and shared read-only access. - Utilize ORM (Object-Relational Mapper) libraries if using Node.js, Django, or Ruby on Rails for easier database querying. 4. API: - Implement a RESTful API with documented endpoints for creating, retrieving, updating, and deleting job reports and managing users. 5. Printing: - Use CSS and media queries to style a printer-friendly version of the document, or leverage a PDF generation library (like Puppeteer for Node.js) to convert the content to a PDF for printing. 6. Competency codes integration: - Incorporate IET competency codes into the application, making it possible for users to link their reports to relevant competencies. Once you have designed and implemented the application, consider deploying it to a hosting service such as Heroku, Netlify, or Digital Ocean. Keep in mind that developing a fully-featured web application takes time and experience. The brief description provided above only serves as a high-level guide. You may need to delve into the details of each technology as you proceed with your project. Good luck!

user_query: System analysis by David Easton
reference_response: David Easton developed the concept of system analysis in the field of political science. System analysis refers to the study of political systems and their components, such as institutions, actors, and processes, in order to understand how they function and interact with each other. Easton's system analysis framework is based on the idea that political systems can be understood as a set of inputs, conversion processes, and outputs. Inputs refer to the demands, support, and resources that are brought into the political system by various actors and groups. Conversion processes involve the transformation of these inputs into policy decisions and actions by political institutions and actors. Finally, outputs are the outcomes and consequences of these policy decisions and actions. According to Easton, system analysis helps in understanding the functioning of political systems by focusing on the interrelationships between different components and the ways in which they contribute to the overall stability and effectiveness of the system. He also emphasized the role of feedback mechanisms in maintaining the equilibrium of political systems. Easton's system analysis has been widely applied in the study of various political phenomena, such as policy-making, decision-making processes, and the role of different actors in the political system. It has provided a useful framework for analyzing the complex and dynamic nature of political systems and has helped in identifying the factors that shape political outcomes. Overall, David Easton's system analysis has made significant contributions to the field of political science by providing a systematic approach to understanding political systems and their functioning. It has helped researchers and analysts to gain insights into the complexities of politics and to develop theories and models for explaining political behavior and outcomes.
redacted_query: System analysis by [REDACTED]

JILAL Mohamed TAOUFYQ Anass Kamal Ramdhan AZZOUZI Salah OUCHARRA Hiba BOULOIZ Aya SEDKI Rim 3 1 2 5 4 3 5 3 5 3 2 8 1 6 7 7 3 5 6 9 3 4 7 1 2 4 5 5 1 4 Votre sortie doit spécifier le nombre total de votes, le nombre de votes valides et le nombre de votes annulés. Viennent ensuite les votes obtenus par chaque candidat et le(s) gagnant(s) de l'élection. Votre programme doit envoyer la sortie suivante à resultats.txt : Vote invalide : 8 Vote invalide : 9 Nombre d'électeurs : 30 Nombre de votes valides : 28 Nombre de votes annules : 2 Candidat score JILAL Mohamed 4 TAOUFYQ Anass 3 Kamal Ramdhan 6 AZZOUZI Salah 4 OUCHARRA Hiba 6 BOULOIZ Aya 2 SEDKI Rim 3 Les gagnants: Kamal Ramdhan OUCHARRA Hiba
reference_response:
Voici un exemple de programme en C qui lit les noms des candidats depuis le fichier `votes.txt`, compte les votes, et écrit les résultats dans le fichier `resultats.txt`. Avant d'exécuter ce programme, assurez-vous que le fichier `votes.txt` est formaté correctement et se trouve dans le même répertoire que votre programme compilé. ```c #include <stdio.h> #include <stdlib.h> #define MAX_CANDIDATES 10 #define MAX_VOTES 100 int main() { FILE *fileIn, *fileOut; char candidates[MAX_CANDIDATES][100]; int votes[MAX_VOTES], candidateTally[MAX_CANDIDATES] = {0}; int totalVotes = 0, validVotes = 0, invalidVotes = 0; int i, vote, maxVotes = 0; // Ouvrir le fichier "votes.txt" pour la lecture fileIn = fopen("votes.txt", "r"); if (fileIn == NULL) { perror("Erreur lors de l'ouverture du fichier"); return EXIT_FAILURE; } int candidateCount = 0; // Lire les noms des candidats while (fgets(candidates[candidateCount], sizeof(candidates[candidateCount]), fileIn) != NULL && candidateCount < MAX_CANDIDATES) { // Supprimer le saut de ligne en fin de chaîne candidates[candidateCount][strcspn(candidates[candidateCount], "
")] = 0; candidateCount++; } // Lire les votes while (fscanf(fileIn, "%d", &vote) == 1) { totalVotes++; if (vote > 0 && vote <= candidateCount) { validVotes++; candidateTally[vote - 1]++; } else { invalidVotes++; } } fclose(fileIn); // Fermer le fichier de lecture // Ouvrir le fichier "resultats.txt" pour l'écriture fileOut = fopen("resultats.txt", "w"); if (fileOut == NULL) { perror("Erreur lors de l'ouverture du fichier"); return EXIT_FAILURE; } fprintf(fileOut, "Nombre d'electeurs : %d
", totalVotes); fprintf(fileOut, "Nombre de votes valides : %d
", validVotes); fprintf(fileOut, "Nombre de votes annules : %d
", invalidVotes); fprintf(fileOut, "Candidat score
"); // Trouver le score le plus élevé for (i = 0; i < candidateCount; i++) { if (candidateTally[i] > maxVotes) { maxVotes = candidateTally[i]; } } // Écrire les scores et déterminer si chaque candidat est un gagnant for (i = 0; i < candidateCount; i++) { fprintf(fileOut, "%s %d
", candidates[i], candidateTally[i]); } fprintf(fileOut, "Les gagnants:
"); for (i = 0; i < candidateCount; i++) { if (candidateTally[i] == maxVotes) { fprintf(fileOut, "%s
", candidates[i]); } } fclose(fileOut); // Fermer le fichier d'écriture return EXIT_SUCCESS; } ``` Ce programme suppose que votre fichier `votes.txt` est organisé avec un candidat par ligne, suivi par les votes qui sont tous des nombres séparés par des espaces. Assurez-vous que votre fichier `votes.txt` correspond à ce format afin que le programme fonctionne correctement. Pour compiler et exécuter ce programme, procédez comme suit : 1. Enregistrez le code ci-dessus dans un fichier, disons `election.c`. 2. Ouvrez un terminal ou une invite de commande sur votre système. 3. Compilez le programme avec une commande telle que `gcc -o election election.c` (pour les systèmes utilisant GCC). 4. Lancez le programme compilé avec `./election` (sous Unix) ou `election` (sous Windows). Après l'exécution du programme, les résultats de l'élection seront écrits dans le fichier `resultats.txt`.

user_query: 1. 先总结你所选的公司(我选择的是Nvidia)——公司是一家经营XX业务的LTD/PLC 2. 选择研究这个公司的原因(任选一个)——个人兴趣爱好、个人使用过该公司的产品或服务、行业竞争压力加剧 、市场潮流趋势 、科技发展、 全球化 等 3. 你如何进行的分析以及你分析了哪些内容——比如：分析了员工的工作积极性、公司的团队合作与分工、公司的福利、文化、团队凝聚力、管理者的管理模式、管理者的个人魅力、领导力风格等 4. 基于你的分析你为公司提出两到三点建议recommendation，例如： 为了激励员工，你建议公司使用其中一种 Motivation theory 为了提升公司管理者的领导力，你建议公司使用其中一种 Leadership theory
reference_response: 1. Nvidia Corporation 是一家专注于图形处理单元 (GPU) 设计和制造的公司，同时也参与人工智能计算、数据中心运算以及汽车相关技术的领域。它是一家上市公司（PLC），在纳斯达克上市，股票代码为NVDA。 2. 我选择研究Nvidia的原因是科技发展。Nvidia处在半导体和深度学习技术的前沿，对计算机视觉、无人驾驶汽车、云计算和游戏等领域起着至关重要的作用。随着科技的不断进步，图形处理技术成为一个快速发展的行业，我对Nvidia如何保持其技术领先地位和商业成功感到非常感兴趣。 3. 我进行的分析包括了公司文化、团队合作与分工、福利和激励机制、管理风格，以及领导力风格。我审阅了公司的公开报道和报道，分析员工的评论（例如在Glassdoor等职场网站上），并查看了公司在社交媒体和其网站上发布的相关信息。我也分析了公司财务报告和业务战略，以更好地理解公司的市场定位和长远规划。 4. 基于我的分析，我为Nvidia提出以下建议： - 为了激励员工，我建议公司采用Herzberg的双因素理论。Nvidia可以增加员工的工作满意度，通过提供更多的成就感、承认表现、工作本身的兴趣以及成长和晋升机会。同时也应该确保公司的基本因素，如工作环境、薪酬和公司政策等不会导致员工不满意。 - 为了提升公司管理者的领导力，我建议采用变革型领导理论。随着企业的成长和技术的发展，Nvidia的管理者应该成为变革的领导者，鼓励创新思维，激励员工追求更高的目标，并促进团队之间的协作和沟通。通过变革型领导，Nvidia能够更有效地适应市场变化，并保持其竞争优势。 - 此外，为了加强团队凝聚力和合作，我建议公司实施跨部门合作项目，定期组织团队建设活动，并创建内部社交平台以促进不同背景和专业的员工之间的交流与理解。

reference_response: Chapter 1: Old Rivals Mishaali Kapoor from Hyderabad and Kareen Arya from Kolkata were two of India's most formidable female fighters. Ever since their paths crossed years ago, in a fierce match that had both their blood and sweat dripping onto the mat, they had harbored an intense contempt for each other. Their most recent face-off had occurred in an underground cage fight where Mishaali emerged as the victor, causing Kareen's animosity towards her to deepen even further. Mishaali Kapoor, a tall, 5'10" female fighter, possessed a captivating beauty that contradicted her deadly skills. Her smooth, light caramel skin was striking in contrast to her rounded, soft eyebrows, giving her a piercing, mysterious gaze. The warmth of her brown eyes belied the cold passion that ran through her veins - a passion that always drove her to win. Kareen Arya was a coquettish bombshell, standing a bit shorter than Mishaali at 5'8". Her S-shaped bushy eyebrows and hazel eyes gave her a sultry look, while her pout lips always curled in a victorious smirk. Her bronze skin, which glistened under the gym lights, was as tough as her spirit. She was buffer and bustier than her long-time rival, Mishaali, and her muscular form evoked admiration and fear at the same time. The recent wins had not managed to erase the bitterness left in their hearts by their previous defeats. Mishaali, recalling her loss to Melissa, the Spanish fighter in Saudi Arabia, swore under her breath as she savagely threw a punch into the bag. And Kareen, gritting her teeth as she reminisced about her defeat in the hands of Jenn, an Australian in a high-stakes match in Sydney, could feel a fire kindling within her, yearning for redemption and to assert her place once more as one of the best. That night, as both Mishaali and Kareen threw their final punches and wiped the sweat off their brows, their respective cell phones rang. "Hey, Mishaali, this is Vikram," said her manager, sounding breathless. "I know you're tired, but I need you to come in and talk to me tomorrow morning. There's something massive for both of us at stake." Across the city, Kareen's manager, Alok, spoke to her in a similar tone. "Kareen, there's no time to lose. We must meet tomorrow morning and discuss an incredible opportunity." Though exhausted from their latest wins, both fighters agreed to their managers' requests and went to bed filled with anticipation of what their futures might hold. As they drifted off to restless sleep, the possibility of crossing paths with their rivals was never far from their minds, but they agreed to focus on their own personal quests. As their eyes closed and the world around them faded, Mishaali and Kareen both dreamt of a world where they would triumph over their rivals, proving their right to hold the title of the best. Tomorrow, they thought, might be one step closer to earning that world.

To add an attachment to your email, you can use Django's EmailMessage class and attach the file to it. Here's an updated `envoi_email` view function that sends an email with an attachment: ```python from django.core.mail import EmailMessage def envoi_email(request): courrier = Courrier.objects.filter(mention="ETUDE ET COMPTE RENDU", is_active=True) count_courrier = courrier.count() if request.method == 'POST': name = request.POST.get('name') email = request.POST.get('email') message = request.POST.get('message') attachment = request.FILES.get('attachment') email_message = EmailMessage( subject=name, body=message, from_email=email, to=[email], reply_to=[email] ) # attach the file to the email message if attachment: email_message.attach( attachment.name, attachment.read(), attachment.content_type ) email_message.send() # render a success message or redirect to a success page return render(request, 'envoi_email.html', {'success_message': 'Email sent successfully!'}) return render(request, 'envoi_email.html', {"courrier": courrier, "count_courrier": count_courrier}) ``` In the HTML form, you can use the `input` tag to allow the user to attach a file: ```html
{% csrf_token %}
``` Make sure to set the `enctype` attribute of the form to `multipart/form-data` to enable file uploads. Also note that you may need to adjust the `EMAIL_BACKEND` setting in your `settings.py` file to use a compatible email backend that supports file attachments.

Moreover, she got high scores in all other subjects of the base department(such as Deep learning, Bayesian Model selection, Mathematical Forecasting methods), so I wasn’t surprised when she decided to apply to the Université Grenoble Alpes. Therefore, without a doubt, I recommend Anna Remizova for admission and hope that she can develop her passion for Machine Learning into a career and further refine her skills."
reference_response: To Whom It May Concern, It is my pleasure to recommend Anna Remizova, one of my best students, for the Université Grenoble Alpes master’s program in "Science in Industrial and Applied Mathematics". I have known Anna personally since summer 2023 when I was evaluating her knowledge during the exam of the Machine Learning course at the Moscow Institute of Physics and Technology. She answered all my questions swiftly and correctly, moreover, she had a maximum score during the semester, so I confidently proved her knowledge to be excellent (5 points out of 5). But even before that, she was highly recommended to me by the Machine Learning course's lecturer: she was described as a hardworking student with great communication skills, eager to evolve in the field. So in autumn 2023, I gladly agreed to become her thesis supervisor at the base department of Intelligent Systems. From the very first meeting, I noticed her interest in the subject and her desire to succeed as a specialist in machine learning. She proved to be a quick learner and a responsible student. She has done thorough research on the thesis topic and managed to conduct a baseline experiment. Throughout the semester, Anna never missed a sync call and consistently displayed a high level of preparation – she has always had a piece of work done and a list of questions for future work. Moreover, she received high scores in all other subjects of the base department (such as Deep learning, Bayesian Model selection, Mathematical Forecasting methods), so I wasn't surprised when she decided to apply to the Université Grenoble Alpes. Therefore, without a doubt, I recommend Anna Remizova for admission and hope that she can develop her passion for Machine Learning into a career and further refine her skills.
