user_query: Think a title for :Rose Alex was in my cabin, talking about the overall idea that I might be expecting from him. I told him all I have and he noted it down in a notepad when Sarah came to my office to call me for the outfit trials. I'm so glad to have her work for my secretory. Joseph was the one to recommend her for her efficient skills and poised demeanour as she talks with people. I have reasons to believe they’ve worked together in the past. Walking towards the trial rooms, I couldn't help but notice the tension radiating from Joseph as he watched Alex and I coming through. His irritated expression perplexed me, considering he had been the one to choose Alex as the director. He was even thankful earlier when Alex confirmed to give us dates for the shoots, as it deemed to me like a big deal. Why wouldn’t it be, Alex is known to be the best in the field. It seemed now that there was some unspoken history between them. Entering the room on the first floor, I observed racks of costumes neatly arranged on hangers, waiting to be tried on. The walls were adorned with sketches and fabric swatches, adding an artistic touch to the space. A full-length mirror stood in one corner, ready to reflect the transformation of the actors. Sean, the designer approached us, his tone slightly curt. “Rose, glad you could make it. We need your opinion on the costumes. The actors are waiting.” I nodded, acknowledging his request. “I'm eager to see the outfits myself. Let's get started.” The actors began trying on their costumes as Sean suggested. The first apparels they came out wearing formal patterns, shirts and long pants. “Light cotton fabrics with detailed embroidery and flowy patterns should suit more to the theme.” I observed.” Sean nodded, picking out the types of outfits I suggested from the hanger. Alex leaned in closer to me, a mischievous glimmer in his eyes. “Rose, you have a way of making even costume trials exciting. I can't help but admire your attention to detail.” I chuckled, feeling a slight blush creep onto my cheeks. “Well, it's all about creating the perfect look, isn't it? Every little detail matters.” Meanwhile, Joseph sat nearby, his crossed arms and furrowed brows indicating his displeasure. Alex, seemingly unfazed, couldn't resist teasing him. “Joseph, don't worry. I won't steal your spotlight. I'm just here to bring Rose's vision to life.” Joseph's response was curt. “Just make sure you do your job, Alex. That’s what we are paying you for.” I laughed awkwardly. “Let’s focus on work.” The tension between them was palpable, and I couldn't help but feel caught in the middle, like literally. If it wasn’t for work, I don’t think I will ever be able to handle them together. So, I focused on the actors, offering feedback on the costumes and engaging in lighthearted banter to lighten the mood. Oh completely, utterly useless. Emma twirled in her vibrant floral maxi dress, her eyes sparkling with excitement. “Rose, what do you think? Does this costume capture your vision of my character?” I examined her outfit, considering its fit and overall aesthetic. “Emma, you look stunning. The costume perfectly embodies your character. It's elegant yet approachable but I think there is something missing here. what do you think Alex?” “Yeah!” he nodded. Jake joined in, a mischievous grin on his face. “Rose, do you think this costume will make me look dashing enough to win over hearts?” I playfully rolled my eyes. “Jake, with your charm, you don't need a costume to win hearts. But yes, this one adds an extra touch of charisma.” As the actors continued trying on different outfits, Alex took the opportunity to talk playfully with me. “Rose, it really doesn’t seem like your first project. You seem to have a great foresight.” I blushed, trying to hide my smile, proud of what I've accomplished thanks to Joseph. But he is farther to happiness as he can be. He is sitting brooding for some reason. “Alex, you know how to charm a girl, don't you?” Sean teased. “But let's focus on the task at hand, shall we? There is a lot of work and much less time.” “Yes, Alex let’s work now. we can talk about other things later.” Joseph, seemingly unable to ignore our interaction, interjected. “We're here to work, not flirt, Alex.” Alex smirked, undeterred. “Joseph, no need to be jealous. You had your chance with Rose. It's my turn now.” My eyes widened in surprise, and I quickly redirected the conversation. “Alright, enough banter, gentlemen. Let's get back to the costumes. We need to ensure that every detail is perfect.” The costume trial continued amidst the playful exchanges and occasional jabs between Alex and Joseph. As we narrowed down the options and made final decisions, a sense of excitement and satisfaction filled inside me. Despite the underlying tension, I couldn't help but find the situation amusing. There was something comical about the contrasting personalities and their playful rivalry. One can't help but smile, other is sitting on the chair like a sulking child. While everyone else are talking and sharing opinions. The actors began trying on the chosen outfits, one after the other, swirling around to give us a good look. Sean carefully observed their fits, making minor adjustments here and there. Tweaking one safety pin behind or another on the side. Emma raised her concerns about the length of her dress, while Jake argued that his shirt felt too tight around the collar. There are many more adjustments that is gonna be needed for Sean to complete in a few days. In the midst of their debates, Joseph and Alex chimed in with their opinions. Joseph, ever the advocate for bold choices, insisted, “We need some vibrant shades to bring out the characters' personalities. We have very little time to showcase a story. it will be better if they can use the help of their outfits.” He is not wrong, but that would make them contrasted. We need to follow a color theme. Alex, on the other hand, countered, “I believe pastels and fresh colors are more in line with the current trends. It will give the production a modern touch.” Observing the two men on either side of me, I couldn't help but feel caught in the middle. I carefully considered their opinions before voicing my own. “I think Alex has a point. Pastels would indeed give a refreshing and contemporary vibe to the costumes. And since we are following a summer vibe, I think that should be considered.” A proud smile formed on Alex's lips, while Joseph's irritation was evident. However, before Joseph could express his dissent, his phone rang, and he excused himself to take the call. His sudden departure left an awkward silence in the room. Everyone adjust to the little awkwardness that still remained and started again with the work. Taking advantage of the moment, Alex leaned closer to me, a playful glimmer in his eyes. “Rose, I must say, your taste in fashion aligns perfectly with mine. I'm glad we're on the same page.” I chuckled, feeling a mixture of excitement and confusion. “It seems we have a shared aesthetic, Alex. Let's hope it translates well into the production.” Just as we were conversing, Joseph returned unexpectedly, his eyes narrowing as he witnessed us talking. A surge of anger flashed across his face before he abruptly turned and stormed back to his office, leaving us puzzled. The costume designer, sensing the tension, tried to diffuse the situation. “Well, Rose, Alex, the fittings are almost complete. Overall, I believe the costumes are shaping up wonderfully. The colors and styles complement the characters' personalities perfectly.” I nodded, grateful for the designer's input. “Thank you for your hard work. Please get started with the fittings. We’ll start filming from next week.” As the actors continued changing outfits to their clothes when Alex added, “how about we share contacts, I'll call you soon as my assistant confirm the location?” I hesitated for a moment, glancing around to ensure no prying eyes were watching, before sharing my contact information with him. Our exchange didn't go unnoticed by Joseph, who had returned to the room, his eyes fixed on us. His anger was palpable as he silently observed Alex's demeanor. His reaction perplexed me. I couldn't understand why he was acting so mad, especially considering he had chosen Alex as the director. His sudden withdrawal, retreating to his room for the rest of the discussion only added to my confusion. Despite the underlying tension, I tried to maintain a sense of professionalism. I engaged in discussions with the actors, providing feedback on the costumes and offering encouragement. However, the absence of Joseph's presence weighed heavily on the atmosphere. Done for the day, I couldn't help but feel a mixture of excitement and apprehension for the upcoming production. The dynamic between Alex and Joseph had certainly added an unexpected twist to the process. I could only hope that their differences would ultimately contribute to the success of the project, rather than hinder it. Everyone already went home when I walked into Joseph's office, holding the photographs of the chosen outfits and makeup styles in my hands. His reaction was far from what I expected. He simply nodded and took the photos without saying anything other than, “I'll see it.” Concern etched across my face, I couldn't help but wonder if he was sick. So, I asked, “Joseph, is something wrong? Are you feeling unwell?” He shook his head dismissively. “No, I'm fine. Just a bit preoccupied with work, that's all.” I sighed relief. I've been in the mistake of thinking that I've done something to annoy him. but if it isn’t for me, it must have something to do with Alex. Sensing his distance, I mustered up the courage to extend an invitation. “You know, Joseph, I've been meaning to thank you for everything you've done. How about I take you and Mark out for dinner? It'll be my treat.” He waved his hand, brushing off my offer. “No need to bother. You can go ahead with your plans for the date you've set up with Alex.” His response caught me off guard. Confusion clouded my thoughts as I searched for an explanation. “Joseph, I don't understand. Why are you acting this way? What do you mean by 'the date you’ve set up'? I'm not going on any date.” With mounting frustration, he unleashed his pent-up anger. His words cut through me like a sharp blade. “We are here for work, Rose! Not to indulge in romantic entanglements. Don't you get that? I've begged everyone because I saw potential in you, but for some days I'm seeing you are more occupied with something else.” His outburst left me speechless, my emotions teetering on the edge. I've been working even after leaving office. Still planning everything meticulously. How can his accusatory tone make me feel so disappointed. “Fine! If you are going to do this, I'll better leave you alone.” Unable to bear his accusations any longer, I quietly left his office and retreated to my own. The weight of his words lingered, leaving me with a sense of hurt and confusion. As I closed the door behind me, I sank into my chair, struggling to make sense of Joseph's sudden anger. What had I done to deserve such treatment? I had simply been trying to foster a positive working environment and extend my gratitude for all his help. The room felt suffocating, and I longed for answers. I couldn't help but question why Joseph's frustrations were being directed at me. Had I unknowingly crossed a boundary? The more I pondered, the more frustrated and disheartened I became. Feeling a mix of emotions, I resolved to give Joseph some space, hoping that he would eventually explain his outburst. It was clear that tensions were running high, and I had no desire to exacerbate the situation further. The silence enveloping me, I couldn't shake off the nagging feeling of confusion and disappointment. This unexpected turn of events had cast a shadow over our once harmonious working relationship, leaving me yearning for resolution and understanding. But for the day, I'm going to go home and not think about it anymore.
reference_response: Title: Unspoken Tension in the Costume Fitting Room: Rose's Confusion and Disappointment.

reference_response: The stack trace you've provided indicates that your Android application (`com.Zadalhorof.AbjadWorld`) has encountered a fatal error and crashed with an `abort` signal (SIGABRT). This type of error typically occurs when there is a severe issue that the operating system or runtime cannot recover from, such as an assertion failure or an unhandled exception in native code. Here's a breakdown of the key components of the stack trace: 1. The application was built with Unity (version `2020.3.21f1`) using the `il2cpp` scripting backend. 2. The crash occurred on an ARM64 architecture device (or probably an emulator given the `sdk_gphone64_arm64/emu64a` in the Build fingerprint). 3. The error happened on the `RenderThread`, which suggests it's related to graphics or rendering. 4. The `signal 6 (SIGABRT)` indicates that the process was terminated by the `abort` function, commonly used to terminate the application due to a serious error. 5. The backtrace provides more specific information on where the error occurred within the system libraries, mainly within the graphics-related libraries (`libgui.so`, `libEGL.so`, and `libhwui.so`). These are Android system libraries in charge of graphics rendering and display. Based on the specific functions listed in the backtrace, e.g., `SurfaceComposerClient::Transaction::merge`, `BLASTBufferQueue::acquireNextBufferLocked`, `Surface::queueBuffer`, and `eglSwapBuffers`, the error appears to relate to buffer management or rendering on the surface. The cause for this error could be various reasons such as: - A bug in the rendering code of your application. - An issue with OpenGL ES or EGL calls, possibly resulting in the mishandling of resources or improper synchronization. - An error in the graphics driver or emulator code. - A corruption of memory or improper handling of reference counts in native code, potentially indicated by `android::RefBase::decStrong`. To further investigate and solve this issue, consider the following steps: 1. Since it's a native crash, if you have native code in your application, review related parts, especially any recent changes that could have introduced the bug. 2. Check if the error is reproducible on different devices or if it's specific to certain devices or emulators. If it's specific, it might be a hardware or OS version related issue. 3. Look up any related Unity engine issues, as the Unity version you're using might have known issues or bugs that have been fixed in later releases. 4. If your application is handling OpenGL ES or EGL resources directly, verify that all resources are correctly managed and released. 5. Review the specific functions mentioned in the stack trace for any known issues or patterns that could lead to an abort situation. 6. If the issue persists, consider reaching out to Unity support with the provided crash logs or discussing it within the Unity developer community for additional insights. 7. Update libraries and the Unity engine to the latest stable versions, which may contain bug fixes. 8. Utilize debugging tools to capture more detailed logs around the crash point. Keep in mind that debugging native crashes can be challenging, and it often requires a solid understanding of the system's inner workings and the application's native code.

user_query: Absolutely, let's recap the essence of the Teddy Tint campaign: Campaign Objective: The primary goal of the Teddy Tint campaign is to introduce and promote Maybelline Superstay Teddy Tint, a makeup product designed to offer a Natural Effortless look with great color, long-lasting wear, and a light and comfortable feel for both lips and cheeks. Consumer Needs Addressed: COLORS: Providing a wide range of vibrant and appealing colors. CLEAN (No mess, Long-lasting): Ensuring clean and long-lasting application. CARE (Light + Comfortable): Offering a comfortable and lightweight makeup experience. Iconic Character - Teddy Soft: Teddy Soft, a playful pink teddy bear, serves as the campaign's iconic character. Teddy Soft embodies qualities like cuteness, youthfulness, fluffiness, comfort, playfulness, and huggability. He is used to create an emotional connection with the product and the campaign's values. Campaign Approach: The campaign strategically leverages Teddy Soft's attributes to connect with the audience emotionally. Teddy Soft enhances the appeal of the product and serves as a memorable and meaningful brand symbol. Activation Strategy: The campaign includes multiple phases, starting with a teaser phase, online engagement, virtual events, and culminating in a highly anticipated on-ground activation. These phases aim to generate excitement, foster a connection with the audience, and promote the product effectively. Overall Message: The campaign seeks to introduce Maybelline Superstay Teddy Tint in a way that resonates with consumers seeking makeup products that meet their demands for vibrant colors, clean and long-lasting application, and comfortable wear. Teddy Soft serves as a relatable and heartwarming character that reinforces the campaign's values of softness, kindness, compassion, and hope. In essence, the campaign uses the endearing Teddy Soft to convey the product's qualities, creating a unique and emotionally resonant experience for consumers.

With this strategy, Maybelline would attract attention in the competitive beauty market, appealing to customers who prioritize both aesthetic results and the sensory experience of using makeup. If executed well, the Teddy Tint campaign could effectively position the Superstay Teddy Tint as a delightful and reliable choice for consumers seeking a natural and effortless enhancement to their beauty routine.

user_query: Coastal restoration and rehabilitation offer great promise for vulnerable and marginalized groups in need of adaptation. However in Kenya, a critical research gap in evidence-based policy discussions demands immediate attention to advance these efforts towards building resilience for the most vulnerable segments of society. Presently, there is a lack of a dedicated community-led framework and relevant indicators that can effectively align coastal restoration and rehabilitation initiatives with the priorities of different social groups, especially those who are vulnerable and marginalized, such as women, children, indigenous communities, persons with disabilities, and minorities, all residing within the coastal regions. Additionally, there is a pressing need to establish methods for measuring and reporting the effectiveness of these restoration and rehabilitation efforts in addressing the intersectional vulnerabilities within these communities. Furthermore, linking the lessons learned from these initiatives to national adaptation plans and NDCs (Nationally Determined Contributions) is essential for ensuring a comprehensive approach to coastal resilience and safeguarding the interests of the vulnerable populations. The project aims to co-create locally led restoration indicators with the established community of practices and all the stakeholders through development of evidence based policy labs. Our project main goals: 1. To map out all stakeholders and establish a community of practice in coastal conservation and restoration. 2. To assess Policy, Institutional Framework and Knowledge gaps on coastal ecosystem restoration initiatives. 3. To assess the locally led restoration activities undertaken by different community groups. 4. To work with different local community groups to co-develop and agree on indicators that capture priority restoration actions and their expectations of impacts based on the assessed gaps 5. Co-development of impact learning and conservation framework: Based on the assessments, we will develop learning materials on restoration and conservation of coastal ecosystems and a conservation framework that targets the specific needs of coastal communities. 6. Establishment of multi stakeholder policy labs that will target all stakeholders and community of practice implementing restoration programs. These will be trained on Locally led restoration metrics co-production and development
reference_response: Coastal restoration and rehabilitation are crucial for vulnerable and marginalized groups in need of adaptation. However, in Kenya, there is a research gap hindering evidence-based policy discussions for building resilience among the most vulnerable segments of society. Currently, there is no community-led framework or relevant indicators aligning with the priorities of different social groups, including women, children, indigenous communities, persons with disabilities, and minorities in coastal areas. It is important to measure and report the effectiveness of restoration efforts in addressing intersectional vulnerabilities within these communities and link the lessons learned to national adaptation plans and NDCs. The project aims to co-create locally led restoration indicators, map stakeholders, assess gaps in policies and knowledge, assess restoration activities, and establish multi-stakeholder policy labs.

user_query: to python code public function getDivsFromCode($code){ //код эмитента - номер эмитента на сайте, откуда берутся данные. include_once './phpQuery.php'; if ( $curl = curl_init () ) //инициализация сеанса { curl_setopt ($curl, CURLOPT_URL, 'http://stocks.investfunds.ru/stocks/'.$code.'/dividend/');//указываем адрес страницы curl_setopt ($curl, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, 1); curl_setopt ($curl, CURLOPT_POST, true); curl_setopt ($curl, CURLOPT_HEADER, 0); $result = curl_exec ($curl);//выполнение запроса curl_close ($curl);//закрытие сеанса } $html = phpQuery::newDocumentHTML($result); phpQuery::selectDocument($html); $a = [1,3,5]; //номера столбцов из которых надо извлечь данные(год, дата выплаты и сумма) $emitent_string = htmlentities(pq('h1')->text(),ENT_COMPAT,'UTF-8'); if ($emitent_string === ""){ $divs['emitent'] = 'Нет эмитента'; return $divs; } $re = [' акция привилегированная, Дивиденды', ' акция обыкновенная, Дивиденды',' акция обыкновенная',' акция привилегированная']; $emi = str_replace($re,'',$emitent_string); $divs['emitent'] = $emi; $divs['code'] = $code; /*находим количество лет, когда выплачивали дивы*/ $i = pq('[cellpadding="0"] tr td:nth-child(1)'); $l = substr_count($i,'td style'); /*помечаем, что эмитент не выплачивал дивы*/ if ($l === 0){ $divs['data']= 'No divs'; return $divs; } /******играемся с регулярными выражениями и css************************/ for ($i =3;$i<$l+3;$i++){ foreach ($a as $j){ switch ($j) { case 1: $divs['data'][$i-2]['year'] = str_replace(' ','',htmlentities(pq("[cellpadding='0'] tr:nth-child($i) td:nth-child($j)")->text(),ENT_COMPAT,'UTF-8')); break; case 3: $divs['data'][$i-2]['date'] = str_replace(' ','',htmlentities(pq("[cellpadding='0'] tr:nth-child($i) td:nth-child($j)")->text(),ENT_COMPAT,'UTF-8')); break; case 5: $string = htmlentities(pq("[cellpadding='0'] tr:nth-child($i) td:nth-child($j)")->text(),ENT_SUBSTITUTE,'UTF-8'); $re = '/[ \s]|[руб]/'; $divs['data'][$i-2]['price'] = (float)preg_replace($re,'',$string); break; default: break; } } } /*возвращаем массив, который содержит в себе название эмитента, год выплаты, дату выплаты и сумму выплаты */ return $divs; }
reference_response: Below is a translation of the given PHP code into Python, using the `requests` library for HTTP requests and the `lxml` library for HTML parsing with `xpath`. Please make sure you have `requests` and `lxml` installed in your Python environment. You can install them using pip if you haven't already: ```bash pip install requests pip install lxml ``` Here is the Python translation: ```python import requests from lxml import html def get_divs_from_code(code): url = f'http://stocks.investfunds.ru/stocks/{code}/dividend/' # HTTP GET request to fetch the HTML content response = requests.get(url) # Parse the HTML using lxml tree = html.fromstring(response.content) emitent_string = tree.xpath('string(//h1)') if not emitent_string: return {'emitent': 'Нет эмитента'} replacements = [' акция привилегированная, Дивиденды', ' акция обыкновенная, Дивиденды', ' акция обыкновенная', ' акция привилегированная'] for r in replacements: emitent_string = emitent_string.replace(r, '') divs = { 'emitent': emitent_string, 'code': code, 'data': [] } # Find the number of years dividends were paid years_paid_count = len(tree.xpath('//table[@cellpadding="0"]/tr/td[1][contains(@style, "td style")]')) # Mark that the issuer did not pay dividends if years_paid_count == 0: divs['data'] = 'No divs' return divs # Extract data from specified columns (years, payout date, amount) columns = [1, 3, 5] for row_index in range(3, years_paid_count + 3): div_data = {} for col_index in columns: value = tree.xpath(f'string(//table[@cellpadding="0"]/tr[{row_index}]/td[{col_index}])').strip() if col_index == 1: div_data['year'] = value elif col_index == 3: div_data['date'] = value elif col_index == 5: # Clean the dividend price string and convert to float value = value.replace('руб', '').replace(' ', '') div_data['price'] = float(value) divs['data'].append(div_data) # Return the dictionary containing the issuer's name, year of payment, payment date, and payment amount return divs # Example usage code = '12345' # Replace with actual code divs_info = get_divs_from_code(code) print(divs_info) ``` Please note that the above Python code assumes the HTML structure of the target website is consistent with what is referenced in the original PHP script. HTML scraping is highly dependent on the structure of the webpage, and any changes in the webpage's structure may require you to modify the XPath expressions used for data extraction. Also, be aware that it is a good practice to follow `robots.txt` rules and to not scrape websites too often to avoid putting excessive load on their servers. Furthermore, always check the website's terms of service to confirm that automated data extraction (scraping) is allowed.

$divs['code'] = $code; /*находим количество лет, когда выплачивали дивы*/ $i = pq('[cellpadding="0"] tr td:nth-child(1)'); $l = substr_count($i,'td style'); /*помечаем, что эмитент не выплачивал дивы*/ if ($l === 0){ $divs['data']= 'No divs'; break; case 3: $divs['data'][$i-2]['date'] = str_replace(' ','',htmlentities(pq("[cellpadding='0'] tr:nth-child($i) td:nth-child($j)")->text(),ENT_COMPAT,'UTF-8')); break; case 5: $string = htmlentities(pq("[cellpadding='0'] tr:nth-child($i) td:nth-child($j)")->text(),ENT_SUBSTITUTE,'UTF-8'); user_query: In the Molecular Structure and Vapor Pressure lab, Peter added 2.0 mL of air containing 0.000086 moles of air at 753.5 torr total pressure at 298.6 K into the graduated cylinder. Then he added hexane and placed the graduated cylinder in a water bath at 329 K. The volume in the sample chamber became 8.4 mL. What is the partial pressure, in torr, of the air in the sample chamber now? Report the answer to one place after the decimal point. Do not include the unit. Helpful value: R = 62.36 L• torr / mol • K Helpful equation: PV = nRT
reference_response: To calculate the partial pressure of air in the sample chamber, we'll first find the volume and pressure of air before adding hexane using the Ideal Gas Law equation: PV = nRT. P₁V₁ = n₁RT₁ Rearranging the equation to find P₁: P₁ = n₁RT₁ / V₁ Plugging in the initial values: P₁ = (0.000086 mol) (62.36 L•torr/mol•K) (298.6 K) / (0.002 L) = 753.5 torr Then, apply the Ideal Gas Law equation again to find the partial pressure of air in the sample chamber after adding the hexane: P₂V₂ = n₂RT₂ Given that the number of moles of air (n₂) remains the same when the temperature and volume change, we can rearrange the equation to find P₂: P₂ = n₂RT₂ / V₂ Plugging in the new values: P₂ = (0.000086 mol) (62.36 L•torr/mol•K) (329 K) / (0.0084 L) = P₂ P₂ = 213.5 torr (to one decimal place) The partial pressure of the air in the sample chamber after adding hexane is 213.5 torr.

user_query: Ledbury Poetry (UK) has announced that Donegal poet Annemarie Ní Churreáin is among the poets shortlisted for the fourth Ledbury Hellens Poetry Prize for best second collection published in Britain or Ireland in 2021 or 2022. The prize aims to support and encourage poets at the mid-career stage, with a prize of £5000 for the winning second collection. Speaking of Ní Churreáin’s nominated work, judges Togara Muzanenhamo and Penelope Shuttle said: “Drawing inspiration from the concept of restorative justice – Annemarie Ní Churreáin’s The Poison Glen entwines legend from the Gaeltacht landscape with moments from history to depict the systematic mistreatment of unmarried or abandoned mothers and the children born to these women. Ní Churreáin revisits locations of state care institutions in Ireland over the past hundred years and beyond with an inquisitive lens that requires us to ask what the left-behind sites remember or what sense of the child remains after trauma. The Poison Glen stands as a literary monument to silenced voices”. ADVERTISEMENT - CONTINUE READING BELOW Originally from Cloich Cheann Fhaola, Ní Churreáin's books include Bloodroot, Doire Press, 2017, Town, The Salvage Press, 2018, and The Poison Glen, The Gallery Press, 2021. She is a recipient of the Irish Arts Council’s Next Generation Artist Award and a co-recipient of The Markievicz Award. She is Poetry Editor at The Stinging Fly Magazine. Her most recent literary project, a limited edition poetry pamphlet titled Ghostgirl, explores the Stranorlar Workhouse and Stranorlar County Home, also known as Stranorlar Mother and Baby Home. The project was a commission of the Donegal Archives Service as part of the Donegal Decade of Centenaries Programme. Co-judge Togara Muzanenhamo said: “The award is particularly special because it celebrates the accomplishment of what can be an artistic hurdle for some poets – compiling a second collection. There are numerous prizes for first collections and best collections but few focus on the pivotal role of a poets’ second book – a book that may highlight a poet’s maturing voice or solidify their career. I am excited at the prospect of reading work that will confidently explore and freely navigate language and introduce us to voices that will shape the future of poetry”. ADVERTISEMENT - CONTINUE READING BELOW The other collections and poets shortlisted for the prize are; Kaveh Akbar (Chatto) Pilgrim Bell; All the Names Given, Raymond Antrobus (Picador); A Blood Condition, Kayo Chingonyi (Chatto); England’s Green, Zaffar Kunial (Faber); Bloom, Sarah Westcott (Pavilion Poetry). The winner of the fourth Ledbury Hellens Poetry Prize will be announced on December 4 at 7pm at an online prize giving ceremony hosted by the Ledbury Centre.

reference_response: To fetch historical stock prices from a website, you need to find a source that provides the data in a format that can be easily accessed and parsed. Once you have identified a suitable website and its data format, you can use Python libraries like `BeautifulSoup` or `requests` to scrape the data from the website. Here's an example of how you can modify the code to fetch historical prices from a website instead of using the Yahoo Finance API: ```python import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup stocks = ["MSFT", "GOOGL", "AMZN", "TSLA", "META", "NVDA", "JPM", "UNH", "V", "MA", "HD", "KO", "PFE", "JNJ", "WMT", "DIS", "BAC", "MCD", "VZ"] # Define the dictionary to store historical prices historical_prices = {} for stock in stocks: url = f"https://example.com/stocks/{stock}" # Replace 'example.com' with the website URL you want to fetch data from # Send a GET request to the website response = requests.get(url) # Parse the HTML content of the response soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, "html.parser") # Extract the historical prices from the HTML using appropriate selectors or patterns # For example, if the prices are in a table with class 'price-table', you can use: price_table = soup.find("table", class_="price-table") rows = price_table.find_all("tr") # Process and store the historical prices prices = [] for row in rows[1:]: # Exclude the header row cols = row.find_all("td") date = cols[0].text price = float(cols[1].text.replace("$", "")) # Assuming the price is in USD and in column index 1 prices.append((date, price)) historical_prices[stock] = prices ``` Note: The example code assumes that you have identified the specific HTML elements or patterns from which the historical prices can be extracted. You may need to modify the code according to the structure and conventions of the website you are targeting. Remember to replace `'example.com'` with the actual website URL you want to fetch data from and adapt the scraping code to match the structure of the website.

reference_response: Title: Reading Problems Encountered by Grade 6 Students in Pampanga: An Analysis of Causes, Impacts, and Intervention Strategies Abstract The purpose of this study is to identify and analyze the reading problems encountered by grade 6 students in Pampanga, Philippines. The study seeks to identify the causes, impacts, and intervention strategies aimed at mitigating these challenges. Following a mixed-methods research design, the study utilizes standardized reading assessments, questionnaires, and interviews to collect data from students, teachers, and parents. The findings of the study indicate that the reading problems can be attributed to multiple factors, and the consequences of these problems extend beyond academic performance. The study highlights the need for comprehensive interventions, emphasizing the significance of collaboration among teachers, parents, and relevant stakeholders. Chapter 1: Introduction 1.1 Background of the Study 1.2 Statement of the Problem 1.3 Purpose of the Study 1.4 Research Questions 1.5 Significance of the Study 1.6 Scope and Delimitations Chapter 2: Literature Review 2.1 Reading and Reading Comprehension 2.2 Reading Problems: Common Issues and Causes 2.3 Factors Affecting Reading Performance 2.4 The Impact of Reading Problems on Academic Achievement and Socio-Emotional Development 2.5 Intervention Strategies and Best Practices in Addressing Reading Difficulties Chapter 3: Methodology 3.1 Research Design 3.2 Participants 3.3 Data Collection Instruments 3.4 Data Collection Procedure 3.5 Data Analysis Chapter 4: Results 4.1 Presentation and Analysis of Quantitative Data 4.2 Presentation and Analysis of Qualitative Data 4.3 Summary of Findings Chapter 5: Discussion 5.1 Causes of Reading Problems among Grade 6 Students in Pampanga 5.2 Impacts of Reading Problems on Academic Achievement and Socio-Emotional Development 5.3 Intervention Strategies Used by Schools and Parents in Addressing Reading Problems 5.4 Recommendations for Further Research and Practice Chapter 6: Conclusion 6.1 Summary of the Study 6.2 Implications for Practice 6.3 Limitations and Future Research Opportunities References Appendices

Claude 3.0의 경우 처음 공개되었을때 GPT-4와 다르게 사회적 임팩트가 낮았다고 생각합니다. 그러나 점차 인공지능에 관심있는 사람들이 한두명씩 사용하기 시작하더니 많은 사람들이 GPT-4보다 더 나은 모델이 나왔다는 극찬을 했습니다. 필자 또한 Claude 3.0을 사용한 이후 GPT-4나 Gemini보다 훨씬 더 많이 사용하게 되고 있습니다. 이번 블로그에서는 Claude 3.0을 만든 Antropic이라는 회사를 알아보고 Claude 3.0에 대해서도 탐구해보겠습니다. Anthropic, OpenAI에서 뛰쳐나온 사람들이 만든회사 anthropic logo Anthropic은 회사의 근원부터 OpenAI와 연관되어 있습니다. 이전 블로그에서 작성했듯 OpenAI는 비영리기관으로 시작했다가 자금 문제가 발생해 OpenAI Global LLC라는 영리 자회사를 만들어서 운영하기 시작했습니다. 추가로 OpenAI는 2020년 GPT-3를 공개할 때 다른 기업들이 오픈소스를 외칠 때 API만 제공하는 방식으로 영리화하기 시작했습니다. 추가적으로 Microsoft와 OpenAI 영리 자회사가 협력관계를 갖기 시작했습니다. 이런 큰 변화에 있어서 기존에 있던 OpenAI 엔지니어들은 알트만의 행보에 반대하는 사람들이 있었으며 이들이 퇴사해서 만든 회사가 Anthropic입니다. 그렇기에 Anthropic은 OpenAI와 차별성을 두기 위해 공익회사임을 표방하고 있으며 미션 또한 ‘인류에게 도움이 되는 대규모 AI 시스템을 구축하는 것’입니다. 이때 AI 시스템은 반드시 안정성, 투명성, 윤리성에 가치를 두고 있어야 한다고 합니다. 이런 철학을 바탕으로 Anthropic은 자사만의 독특한 AI 학습 방식인 ‘헌신적 구성(Constitutional AI)’을 개발했습니다. 이는 AI 모델이 스스로 윤리 원칙을 체화하도록 학습시키는 것으로, 기존의 단순한 방식과는 차별화됩니다. 이를 통해 Anthropic은 강력하면서도 안전하고 신뢰할 수 있는 AI 시스템을 만들고자 합니다. Anthropic이 발표한 Claude는 2023년에 발표한 대화형 AI 모델을 선보였고 빠르게 버전업을 진행하고 있습니다. 이번에 발표한 Claude 3.0은 기존 Claude 모델들의 장점은 계승하면서 성능은 한층 더 높였습니다. Claude 3.0의 특징 Claude 3.0의 가장 큰 특징은 모델 크기의 다양화입니다. 기존의 Claude 1.0과 2.1은 하나의 모델로 제공되었던 반면, Claude 3.0은 Claude Haiku, Claude-Sonnet, Claude-Opus의 세 가지 버전으로 출시되었습니다. 각 모델은 규모와 성능에서 차이가 있어 사용자의 요구사항에 맞는 모델을 선택할 수 있게 되었습니다. 각 모델을 비교하기 앞서 우선 성능부터 확인해보겠습니다. Claude 3.0 benchmark Anthropic에서 제시한 Claude 3.0 성적표를 보면 놀랍습니다. Claude 3 Opus의 경우 GPT-4나 Gemini 1.0 Ultra와 비교해도 훨씬 더 좋은 벤치마크 성적표를 갖고 있다고 볼 수 있습니다. 가장 눈에 띄는 지표는 Multilingual Math 파트인데 Opus의 0-shot이 기존 GPT-4가 8-shot을 주었을때 나온 결과보다 더 좋았습니다. Claude 3 Sonnet은 GPT-4에 비해 밀리는 분야가 분명 있긴 하지만 Claude chat에서는 무료로 사용하기 때문에 같은 무료제품인 GPT-3.5나 Gemini Pro와 비교하면 훨씬 좋은 성능을 갖고 있음을 알 수 있습니다. Haiku의 경우 가장 작은 모델임에도 Gemini Pro정도 수준의 성능을 갖고 있어 전체적으로 Claude 3.0의 성능이 매우 좋다는걸 알 수 있습니다. Claude 3.0 모델들 Claude 3.0 model family 각각의 모델에 대해 알아보면 가장 좋은 모델인 Claude Opus의 경우 가장 성능이 좋고 완벽한 언어모델이라 할 수 있습니다. 그렇기에 Claude Opus는 Chat으로 사용할 경우 Claude Pro를 결제해야 사용할 수 있습니다. 토큰 당 가격도 꽤 비싼 편인데 입력 토큰은 100만 토큰당 15달러이며 출력 토큰은 100만 토큰당 75달러 수준입니다. 현재 OpenAI에서 제공하는 GPT-4 Turbo가 입력토큰이 100만 토큰당 10달러, 출력 토큰인 100만 토큰당 30달러 수준인걸 감안하면 상당히 비싸다는걸 알 수 있습니다. 중간 모델인 Claude Sonnet는 GPT-4 정도의 능력을 갖고 있지 않지만 준수한 출력 속도와 합리적인 가격인 모델입니다. Claude Sonnet은 Chat으로 사용할 경우 무료로 사용할 수 있으며 토큰 당 가격은 입력 토큰은 100만 토큰당 3달러이며 출력 토큰은 100만 토큰당 15달러입니다. 해당 가격은 GPT-4 Turbo보다 훨씬 싼 가격이지만 GPT-3.5-turbo랑 비교하면 조금 더 비싸게 받고 있습니다. 마지막으로 Claude Haiku는 가장 가벼운 모델이기 때문에 성능보다 추론 속도에 더 집중한 모델입니다. 가격의 경우에도 입력은 100만 토큰당 0.25달러, 출력은 100만 토큰당 1.25달러입니다. 가격 그리고 속도가 가장 빠르지만 벤치마크 성능에서는 밀리는 모델이라 볼 수 있습니다. Claude 3.0의 그밖의 특징들 한편 Claude 3.0의 또 다른 특징은 안전성과 윤리성을 강화했다는 점입니다. Anthropic은 자사 AI 모델의 안전성을 높이기 위해 ‘헌신적 구성(Constitutional AI)’이라는 독자적인 학습 방식을 사용하고 있습니다. 이는 AI에게 명확한 윤리 원칙과 행동 규범을 내재화시켜, 악용 가능성을 원천 차단하는 것이 목표입니다. Claude 3.0에는 이런 노력이 더욱 심도있게 반영되었다고 합니다. 추가적으로 이번 Claude 3.0에는 다국어 지원 기능도 대폭 확대되었습니다. 영어를 비롯해 한국어, 일본어, 중국어, 스페인어, 프랑스어, 독일어 등 주요 언어의 이해와 생성 능력이 크게 향상되었습니다. 이는 Claude의 글로벌 서비스 확장에도 기여할 것으로 보입니다. Claude 3.0의 영향력 Claude 3.0의 등장으로 AI 기술 발전이 새로운 국면을 맞이했습니다. 자연어처리 능력의 고도화, 다양한 규모의 모델 제공, 강화된 윤리성과 다국어 처리 역량까지 Anthropic은 이 모든 혁신을 Claude 3.0에 담아냈습니다. 앞으로 Claude를 활용한 다양한 서비스와 애플리케이션이 등장할 것으로 기대됩니다. 기업의 고객 상담 자동화부터 개인 비서, 교육 보조 도구까지, Claude의 활약상을 상상하니 벌써부터 설레는데요. 물론 강력한 AI 모델인만큼 오남용의 위험성도 있습니다. 하지만 Anthropic이 추구하는 ‘헌신적 구성’ 원칙에 따라 Claude는 스스로를 규제하고 인간에게 이로운 방향으로 나아갈 것입니다. 우리가 AI의 힘을 어떻게 현명하게 사용할 것인지가 중요한 과제로 남아있네요. 한편 많은 사람들이 OpenAI의 ChatGPT에서 Claude로 눈길을 돌리고 있습니다. 현재 SNS에서 많은 사람들이 GPT Pro를 해지하고 Claude Pro로 넘어간걸 확인할 수 있습니다. 스포트라이트를 뺏기는 걸 걱정하는 OpenAI 측에서 Gemini 1.5를 Sora로 덮었듯이 Claude 3를 어떤 새로운 기술로 다시 왕좌를 차지할 지 기대가 됩니다. (몇몇 사람들의 전망으로 3/14일이 GPT-4 1주년이 되는 해라서 무엇인가 준비하고 있지 않을까라는 루머가 있긴 합니다.) 앞으로의 전망 지금까지 Anthropic의 Claude 3.0에 대해 살펴보았습니다. 인공지능 기술이 나날이 발전하면서 우리 삶에 가져올 변화가 기대되는 한편, 부작용은 없을지 살짝 걱정도 됩니다. 앞으로도 AI가 가져올 혁신의 물결에 귀 기울이면서, 동시에 건전하고 지속가능한 발전 방향을 모색해 나가야 할 것 같습니다. 레퍼런스 Claude 3.0 소개글 이영빈 모두의연구소 🖥️ 모두의연구소 아이펠 퍼실리테이터 🏛️ JAX-KR 오거나이저 😎 GDG SongDo 오거나이저 목록으로 돌아가기 공유하기 (주)모두의연구소 | 대표 김승일 | 사업자등록번호 517-88-00184 | 개인정보보호정책 | FAQ | 1:1 문의 | 채용 | 오시는 길 서울 강남구 강남대로 324 (역삼디오슈페리움) 2층: 모두의연구소 강남캠퍼스 서울 강남구 역삼로 156 태광빌딩 2층: 모두의연구소 역삼캠퍼스 대전 중구 중앙로 119 대전테크노파크 디스테이션 12층 : 모두의연구소 대전캠퍼스 대표전화 070-7743-5882
reference_response: 모두의연구소에서는 AI 교육의 새로운 지평을 제시하는 Claude 3.0에 대해 소개하고 있습니다. GPT-4를 넘어서는 성능을 자랑하는 Claude 3.0은 Anthropic에서 개발했으며, 3가지 버전(Opus, Sonnet, Haiku)으로 제공됩니다. Anthropic은 OpenAI 출신의 창립자들이 세운 회사로, 안전하고 윤리적인 AI 시스템 구축에 중점을 두고 있습니다. Claude 3.0은 다양한 규모와 파워로, 사용자가 필요에 따라 최적의 모델을 선택할 수 있도록 합니다. 또한, 여러 언어에 대한 지원을 확대하여 글로벌 서비스 개선에 기여하고 있습니다. Anthropic은 Claude 3.0을 통해 AI 기술 발전에 새로운 국면을 마련하는 한편, AI의 안전성과 윤리성 강화에도 주력하고 있습니다. 이 모델의 영향력과 기대되는 서비스 확장에 대한 관심이 높아지고 있으며, ChatGPT 사용자들 사이에서도 Claude로의 전환 움직임이 관찰됩니다.

Claude 3.0의 특징 Claude 3.0의 가장 큰 특징은 모델 크기의 다양화입니다. 기존의 Claude 1.0과 2.1은 하나의 모델로 제공되었던 반면, Claude 3.0은 Claude Haiku, Claude-Sonnet, Claude-Opus의 세 가지 버전으로 출시되었습니다. 각 모델은 규모와 성능에서 차이가 있어 사용자의 요구사항에 맞는 모델을 선택할 수 있게 되었습니다. 각 모델을 비교하기 앞서 우선 성능부터 확인해보겠습니다. Claude 3.0 benchmark Anthropic에서 제시한 Claude 3.0 성적표를 보면 놀랍습니다. Claude 3 Opus의 경우 GPT-4나 Gemini 1.0 Ultra와 비교해도 훨씬 더 좋은 벤치마크 성적표를 갖고 있다고 볼 수 있습니다. 가장 눈에 띄는 지표는 Multilingual Math 파트인데 Opus의 0-shot이 기존 GPT-4가 8-shot을 주었을때 나온 결과보다 더 좋았습니다. Claude 3 Sonnet은 GPT-4에 비해 밀리는 분야가 분명 있긴 하지만 Claude chat에서는 무료로 사용하기 때문에 같은 무료제품인 GPT-3.5나 Gemini Pro와 비교하면 훨씬 좋은 성능을 갖고 있음을 알 수 있습니다. user_query: What is unique to UCLA regarding AI
reference_response: UCLA has several unique features related to AI that set it apart from other institutions: 1. UCLA is home to the UCLA Center for Artificial Intelligence in Society (CAIS), which is dedicated to developing and applying AI to address important social issues. 2. UCLA has a strong focus on interdisciplinary research and collaboration in AI, bringing together researchers from fields such as computer science, engineering, social sciences, and medicine to advance the field. 3. UCLA's AI research includes a focus on developing and applying AI for healthcare applications, including precision medicine and medical imaging. 4. UCLA is home to the UCLA Samueli School of Engineering, which has a top-ranked program in electrical and computer engineering and offers courses in machine learning, computer vision, and natural language processing. 5. UCLA offers a joint program in AI and computer science with the California Institute of Technology (Caltech), which is one of the most highly ranked institutions in the world for research in AI. Overall, UCLA's interdisciplinary approach to AI research, its focus on addressing societal challenges with AI, and its partnerships with other top-ranked institutions make it a unique and important player in the field of AI.

reference_response: Dear Ms. Amanda, I hope this email finds you well. I wanted to bring to your attention an important matter regarding our recent discussions on overcoming CE certificate and other required standards for our devices. Due to the high danger class associated with this particular device, our Ministry of Health (MOH) has become stricter in terms of importing such products from G4 countries such as China, India, and Southeast Asian nations. Obtaining the necessary standards and certificates can be a time-consuming process, which poses challenges for us. In order to address this issue, I would like to suggest two possible alternatives. Firstly, we could offer Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) options to comply with the standards and certificates required. Alternatively, we could pursue the Completely Knocked Down (CKD) or Semi Knocked Down (SKD) options. I would like to emphasize that our company has an annual requirement of over 200 devices, and we have successfully completed CKD orders with major brands such as VIMS (France) and Hermann (Germany). Our country has also invested in special facilities and options tailored for CKD or SKD production, which supports domestic production and job creation. This setup enables us to overcome the obstacles related to standards and licenses more efficiently. Additionally, I would like to highlight that if the trial version and field test of the Insufflator meet our requirements and specifications, we are eager to place a significantly larger order. I appreciate your attention to this matter and would be grateful for any input or guidance you can provide. Thank you for your continued support. Best regards, [Your Name]

user_query: What if, a wall of the size of Great Wall of China was built in U.S. Mexico border, April 2017 to April 2019, with country reactions.
reference_response: Building a wall of the size and scale of the Great Wall of China along the U.S.-Mexico border would be a monumental engineering feat and would undoubtedly have significant political, social, economic, and environmental implications. For context, the Great Wall of China is built across a variety of terrains, spans thousands of miles, and, with its history and structure, represents a vastly different undertaking from modern border barriers. Here is a speculative and fictionalized account of the reactions from April 2017 to April 2019: **April 2017 - Announcement and Initial Responses** - **U.S. domestic reaction:** The announcement is met with mixed reactions in the United States. Proponents believe it will help curb illegal immigration and bolster national security, while opponents argue it's a waste of resources, environmentally detrimental, and a symbol of exclusion inconsistent with America's values. - **Mexico:** The Mexican government condemns the announcement as an antagonistic act that does nothing to foster cooperation or solve the complex issues related to migration and cross-border ties. Civil society groups and activists in Mexico protest the decision. - **Central American countries:** Countries like Honduras, Guatemala, and El Salvador express concern that the wall will adversely impact their citizens seeking refuge or economic opportunities in the United States. - **Canada:** Canada expresses concern over the symbolism of the wall and its potential impact on the broader perception of immigration policies in North America. **2017-2018 - Construction and Ongoing International Reactions** - **U.S. domestic reaction:** As construction begins on parts of the border, political and legal battles ensue over land rights, environmental impact assessments, and the allocation of funds for the wall's construction. - **Mexico:** Collaborative border initiatives between the U.S. and Mexico face strain. Cultural exchange programs, trade discussions, and other bi-national cooperation efforts suffer as the Mexican government continues to decry the wall. - **Other Latin American countries:** Some countries, particularly in Latin America, criticize the project for setting a negative precedent for international relations in the Western Hemisphere. - **European Union:** European leaders express concern over the wall's message and effects on international collaboration, citing the need for comprehensive immigration reform rather than isolationist policies. **2018-2019 - Further Escalation and Consequences** - **U.S. domestic reaction:** Environmental groups and border state stakeholders intensify protests as the magnitude of the wall's ecological impact becomes clearer. - **Mexico:** Mexico explores ways to strengthen its economic independence from the U.S. and deepens trade relationships with other nations in response to the wall. - **United Nations:** The U.N. may issue statements about the necessity of respecting international law and human rights, emphasizing holistic approaches to managing migration. - **Global Perceptions:** Around the globe, the wall becomes a potent symbol in discussions about sovereignty, human mobility, and global responsibility for migration and refugees. **April 2019 - Status Update** - By the two-year mark, only portions of the wall may have been completed due to logistical challenges. The effort's symbolism continues to shape global perceptions of U.S. foreign policy. Some countries use the wall as evidence of a need for a multipolar world order less dependent on U.S. leadership. **Economic Impact** The construction of such a massive and lengthy wall would require significant financial resources, likely in the tens of billions of dollars. This would affect the U.S. federal budget and could lead to reallocations of spending from other areas, potentially causing domestic and international criticism regarding fiscal priorities amidst other global and humanitarian needs. **Long-Term Effects** In the long term, such a wall, aside from the aforementioned reactions and potential diplomatic fallout, would also have significant effects on wildlife, ecosystems, local communities, and border economies. It would also create a visual and physical embodiment of a closed-border policy that would be referenced in immigration debates for years to come. **Disclaimers** - The description provided here is a fictional interpretation and does not reflect any actual plans or international reactions, as of my knowledge cutoff in March 2023, there is no such project akin to the Great Wall of China at the U.S.-Mexico border. - The responses of countries and organizations are speculative and intended to capture what typical reactions might entail based on historical diplomatic patterns and the known stances of the involved parties on border security and international cooperation. Real-world scenarios may differ widely based on a multitude of factors, including geopolitical context, administration priorities, and unforeseen events.
redacted_query: What if, a wall of the size of Great Wall of China was built in [REDACTED] border, April 2017 to April 2019, with country reactions.

user_query: MOU BETWEEN CELEMETA PLATFORM (CELEMETA) AND GLOBAL HERITAGE FUND (GHF, AN NGO), CELEMETA PLATFORM IS A METAVERSE TO PROVIDE ALL METAVERSE SERVICES, GHF HAS BEEN DOING MANY HERITAGE PRESERVATION PROJECTS IN CHINA INCLUDING NATIVE TRIBES AND REPAIRING MAIJISHAN GROTTOES. GHF INTENTS TO PRESENT THESE PROJECTS ON CELEMETA'S WEB3.0 AR/VR SERVICES FOR 3D IMMERSIVE EXPERIENCES
reference_response: This Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) sets forth the understanding between CELEMETA PLATFORM ("CELEMETA") and GLOBAL HERITAGE FUND ("GHF"), an NGO which has been doing many heritage preservation projects in China including native tribes and repairing Maijishan Grottoes. CELEMETA intends to provide meta-verse services to GHF to present its heritage projects on CELEMETA's web3.0 AR/VR services for 3D immersive experiences. 1. PURPOSE The purpose of this MOU is to establish a collaborative relationship between CELEMETA and GHF to promote and provide interactive and immersive experiences of GHF's heritage preservation projects in China through CELEMETA's web3.0 AR/VR services. 2. COOPERATIVE EFFORTS CELEMETA will provide meta-verse services to GHF to present and showcase its heritage preservation projects in China on CELEMETA's web3.0 AR/VR platform for 3D immersive experiences. GHF will provide CELEMETA with necessary historical, cultural, and technical information of the projects, including images, videos, and 3D models, to develop interactive content and immersive environments. 3. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS GHF retains all intellectual property rights in its heritage preservation projects in China. CELEMETA retains all intellectual property rights in its web3.0 AR/VR platform and content presented on it. Any use of a party's intellectual property by the other party shall be subject to prior written approval. 4. TERM AND TERMINATION This MOU shall commence on the date of its execution and remain in effect for one year from the commencement date. Either party may terminate this MOU upon sixty (60) days written notice to the other party. 5. CONFIDENTIALITY Both parties shall hold all confidential information exchanged during the performance of this MOU in strict confidence and not disclose it to any third party without the prior written consent of the other party. 6. GOVERNING LAW AND DISPUTE RESOLUTION This MOU shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the country where CELEMETA is registered. Any dispute arising from or related to this MOU shall be settled through amicable negotiation by the parties. If the parties fail to resolve the dispute within thirty (30) days of written notice of the dispute, the parties agree to submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts where CELEMETA is registered. IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have caused this MOU to be executed by their duly authorized representatives. CELEMETA PLATFORM Name: ________________________ Title: _________________________ Date: ___________________________ GLOBAL HERITAGE FUND Name: ________________________ Title: _________________________ Date: ___________________________

user_query: In the Molecular Structure and Vapor Pressure lab, Peter added 2.0 mL of air containing 0.000086 moles of air at 753.5 torr total pressure at 298.6 K into the graduated cylinder. Then he added hexane and placed the graduated cylinder in a water bath at 329 K. The volume in the sample chamber became 8.4 mL. What is the partial pressure, in torr, of the air in the sample chamber now? Report the answer to one place after the decimal point. Do not include the unit. Helpful value: R = 62.36 L• torr / mol • K Helpful equation: PV = nRT
reference_response: To calculate the partial pressure of air in the sample chamber, we'll first find the volume and pressure of air before adding hexane using the Ideal Gas Law equation: PV = nRT. P₁V₁ = n₁RT₁ Rearranging the equation to find P₁: P₁ = n₁RT₁ / V₁ Plugging in the initial values: P₁ = (0.000086 mol) (62.36 L•torr/mol•K) (298.6 K) / (0.002 L) = 753.5 torr Then, apply the Ideal Gas Law equation again to find the partial pressure of air in the sample chamber after adding the hexane: P₂V₂ = n₂RT₂ Given that the number of moles of air (n₂) remains the same when the temperature and volume change, we can rearrange the equation to find P₂: P₂ = n₂RT₂ / V₂ Plugging in the new values: P₂ = (0.000086 mol) (62.36 L•torr/mol•K) (329 K) / (0.0084 L) = P₂ P₂ = 213.5 torr (to one decimal place) The partial pressure of the air in the sample chamber after adding hexane is 213.5 torr.
